title: Yellow Tail Shiraz
raw_ec_shortdesc: From Australia's largest family-owned wine company, a wine that's easy to drink, and easy to understand. It's dry, medium-bodied and softly structured, with aromas and flavours of coffee, floral note, prune, smoke and licorice. The ripe plummy-berry notes lead to a long, spicy finish. Serve with grilled lamb chops.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: From Australia's largest family-owned wine company, a wine that's easy to drink, and easy to understand. It's dry, medium-bodied and softly structured, with aromas and flavours of coffee, floral note, prune, smoke and licorice. The ripe plummy-berry notes lead to a long, spicy finish. Serve with grilled lamb chops.

title: Tbilvino Alazani Valley Medium Sweet Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Saperavi' is the Georgian word for 'paint' or 'dye,' which is fitting considering it's also the name of one of the few teinturier (red-fleshed) grapes that you'll commonly find. This lush, off-dry red has flavours of pomegranate and strawberry with hints of forest floor balanced by a brisk acidity and velvety tannins.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: 'Saperavi' is the Georgian word for 'paint' or 'dye,' which is fitting considering it's also the name of one of the few teinturier (red-fleshed) grapes that you'll commonly find. This lush, off-dry red has flavours of pomegranate and strawberry with hints of forest floor balanced by a brisk acidity and velvety tannins.

title: Mildiani Semi-Sweet Red Kindzmarauli
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is an off-dry red based on Georgia's saperavi grape. It has a generous, soft and ripe nose of plummy, raspberry fruit, lilac and white chocolate. Very pretty. And it is very smooth, semi-sweet and polished. It is really very well made and balanced with fine tannin. The length is very good as well. Chill a bit and consider for mellow, after dinner situations lightly chilled. Tasted March 2023. Score - 89. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This is an off-dry red based on Georgia's saperavi grape. It has a generous, soft and ripe nose of plummy, raspberry fruit, lilac and white chocolate. Very pretty. And it is very smooth, semi-sweet and polished. It is really very well made and balanced with fine tannin. The length is very good as well. title: Beringer Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 1868, Jacob Beringer left Germany and settled in California, where he built the now-historic Beringer Winery. A vibrant Cab with chocolate, prune, licorice, cinnamon and tobacco aromas. Cellar 3-5 years, or decant and pair with roast beef, grilled quail or Beemster cheese.

title: Trapiche Reserve Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: For over 120 years, Bodega Trapiche has been producing and innovating Argentinian wine. The Reserve Malbec is a bold red, expressing aromas and flavours of black cherry, plum and spice. The palate is dry and full-bodied with firm, grippy tannins. Try this robust Malbec with red meats, hearty cheeses or earthy vegetables.

title: Château Rombeau Elise Vieilles Vignes 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: 70% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 10% Mourvedre. Nose is complex, full of cooked dark berries and fruit, pencil, graphite, dark olive, swift of Mediterranean herbs. Palate is complex, well balanced between good acidity and full fine tannins, cacao, blackcurrant cordial, flowers and sweet charred barrels. Finishes with well-judged texture and length. Delicious. Score - 96. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2021)

title: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia Reserva 2012
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2012 Viña Tondonia Reserva comes from a very dry year, with 25% less rain than the average (at the time), resulting in lower yields of very healthy grapes that delivered wines with nice balance between alcohol and polyphenols, making it very apt for the aging in barrel. It had a slightly longer élevage in barrel, six years. The wine is aromatic with a developed profile, spicy and tertiary (forest floor, a touch of brick dust and iodine), complex and nuanced. The palate is full and round, with polished tannins and a long, dry finish. It has a textbook Tondonia nose and profile. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 29, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2012 Viña Tondonia Reserva comes from a very dry year, with 25% less rain than the average (at the time), resulting in lower yields of very healthy grapes that delivered wines with nice balance between alcohol and polyphenols, making it very apt for the aging in barrel. title: Barón de Ley Gran Reserva 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lovely, classic-smelling Rioja Gran Reserva here from stalwart Barón de Ley, complete with toasted coconut, sandalwood, cedar and melted butter flavours, also dried cherry fruit and wild herbs. I love the silky-firm texture, the sapid and saline qualities, the genuine substance and depth. Textbook wine all around, enjoyable now but surely no rush; cellar into the thirties without concern. Tasted July 2024. Score - 92. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: The Chocolate Block 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A skilfully blended and packaged wine that manages to shift large volumes at an extremelyprofitable price, The Chocolate Block is a clever assemblage of mostly Syrah from theGoldmine and Porseleinberg vineyards with 9% Grenache, 8% Cinsault, 5% CabernetSauvignon and 1% Viognier. Fleshy, perfumed and smooth, it has sweet goji berry andsummer pudding fruit, velvety tannins, scented cinnamon oak and a fresh, lifted finish. Drink date: 2024-2029. Score - 93. (timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2023)

title: Antinori Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The nose is a jungle adventure, as sanguine notes of meat and leather intertwine with a thicket of wild herbs, brambles and leaves, and a last hint of wild cherry. The palate teleports to the ice cream parlor on Main Street, serving artisanal, hand-churned mint chip, with a Luxardo cherry on top. A rare combination of extravagant and refreshing. [Drink through 2033+.] Score - 95. (Danielle Callegari, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 1, 2023)

title: Elderton Ode To Lorraine Cabernet Sauvignon/Shiraz/Merlot 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: 51/45/4% cabernet sauvignon/shiraz/merlot from the Elderton Nuriootpa estate; aged for 20 months in French oak puncheons. Deep crimson in the glass with aromas of dark plum, cassis and mulberry with hints of baking spices, dark chocolate, licorice, earth, bay leaf, pencil case and cedar. Some nice fruit plushness on the palate, with powdery tannin support and sense of elegance as the wine flows across the palate finishing long and fruit pure. Drink from: 2023. Score - 94. title: Henschke Mount Edelstone Vineyard Shiraz 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Kaleidoscopic, this glorious vintage is terroir translucent, transporting you to the vineyard with its signature aromas of dried sage, Eucalyptus olida (aka Strawberry Gum), wild mint, wattleseed, nutmeg and tinder. Soaring and super-expressive, these scents bring compelling dimension and meld exquisitely on the sweet, juicy plum and bramble palate, with its cocoa nib and earthy hints. Graceful, willowy tannins and mineral acidity make for a long, fluid, markedly perfumed finish. Irresistible already! Drinking window: 2022-2042. Part of Henschke 2017 single-site Shiraz releases. Score - 98. (Sarah Ahmed, decanter.com, March 29, 2022)

title: Château Siaurac 2014
raw_ec_shortdesc: The ample fruitiness of this 80% Merlot wine is right up front. It comes from a large 116-acre estate on the extension of the Pomerol plateau. Firm tannins as well as generous black plum and berry fruits are well balanced, just needing time to soften and fill out. Drink this full, rich wine from 2018 [through 2026]. Score - 91. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2017)

title: Château Ramage La Batisse 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: This has a very convincing nose, very Médocian in style, with spiced and slightly macerated red plum fruit, with a dusty freshness. The palate feels fresh, full, plump, rather perfumed, perhaps slightly juicy in style, and it is brimming with peony, rose petal, grilled cherry, praline and vanilla. A long and well-focused seam of tannins in the finish feel tightly knit, and around these revolve the wine's peppered fruit. With a nice length too, this wine feels like a fairly smart bet for the cellar.  Score - 94. (Chris Kissack, thewinedoctor.com, undated)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This has a very convincing nose, very Médocian in style, with spiced and slightly macerated red plum fruit, with a dusty freshness. title: Château Jérémie 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: There's a refreshing herbaceous lift in this delicious red, which nicely offsets the dense, ripe fruit profile. Cherry, plum and red currant fill out the palate, flecked with smoked meat, violet, forest floor and mineral details. Pencil shavings line the finish, marked by black pepper and smoke. Shows great character and balance. Carignan, Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now [to 2026]. Ranked #86 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 2023. Score - 92. (Kristen Bieler, winespectator.com, Oct. 15, 2023)

title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: The rather grand chateau of this estate dates to the 19th century, a turreted affair very much in the Médoc tradition. The wine is classic as well, offering balanced acidity, black-currant fruit and a layer of tannins to support everything. The 30% new barrels have added to the wine's richness as well as giving a spicy aftertaste. Drink from 2022. Score - 91. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2019)

title: M Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: I love this easy-to-drink 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon from McPrice Myers that well overdelivers for its price. Deep ruby-purple, it has alluring aromas of cassis, pencil shavings, dried herbs, leather and lavender, plus classy touches of oak spice. The full-bodied palate is concentrated and powerful without going over the top. It has abundant, grainy tannins, flinty streaks and plenty of refreshing acidity to carry the long finish. It's not your average chocolate bomb California Cabernet, despite its modest price tag. Drink date: 2023-2028. Score - 95. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: I love this easy-to-drink 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon from McPrice Myers that well overdelivers for its price. title: Kartuli Vazi Naturally Semi-Sweet 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This naturally semi-sweet red is made from Georgia's most famous grape: Saperavi. Grapes are harvested late and fermentation is halted halfway through the process by chilling the fermenting juice, resulting in a wine with low alcohol and a pleasant sweetness. Expect notes of ripe black plum, sugared dates and pomegranate, with a core of zippy acidity and spicy tannins for balance.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Really sophisticated aromas of blackberries, plums, crushed stones, concrete, wet earth and fresh mushrooms. Complex is the word. title: High on the Hog Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 High on the Hog is composed of 25% Grenache, 25% Zinfandel, 20% Syrah, 14% Petite Sirah, 12% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Mourvèdre. It's scented of red and black plums with touches of tar, turned earth, coffee, chocolate and spicy undertones. The medium to full-bodied palate has generous, juicy fruit, supple, approachable tannins and a long, flavorful finish streaked with spicy accents. This is very easy to drink and offers great quality for the price. Drink date: 2024-2030. Score - 93. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Jan. 31, 2024)

title: Escudero Vidau 2008
raw_ec_shortdesc: Vivid ruby-red. Pungent cherry pit, red currant and cracked pepper scents, along with subtle vanilla and woodsmoke flourishes. Taut and penetrating on the palate, offering bitter cherry and red berry flavors underscored by a vein of juicy acidity. Delivers strong closing thrust, steadily building tannins and a touch of sweet chewing tobacco on the long, incisive finish. Drinking window: 2019-2025. Score - 91. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, Feb. 21, 2019)

title: Montgras Organic Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from red clay, this Pinot Noir was fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel. As a result, it's notably perfumed and floral, with a delightful primary purity and brightness to the strawberry, red cherry and mixed red fruit tones. Elegant, fresh and compelling. A great wine for mushroom-based dishes, roast chicken, or grilled salmon.

title: Tarapacá 150 Anniversary Edition Gran Reserva Red Blend 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Tarapacá, under different ownership and management, has been producing wines for 150 years, always with a focus on Maipo Valley vineyards. This 68% cabernet sauvignon, 30% syrah, and 2% cabernet franc is entirely from estate-owned vineyards surrounding the Tarapacá winery in Isla de Maipo, planted on granite and clay soils. It's a red wine that's very much in the house's style - the smooth texture, the herbal and fruity aromas in similar measure, the very fine, sharp tannins. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Fonjoya Grand Velours Grande Réserve 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fonjoya is the collaborative project of two wineries, one in Saint-Félix-de-Lodez and one in Saint-Saturnin-de-Lucian. It began in 2018, about 100 years after the neighbours each began making wines in the region. The two synergize quite well in this lovely red that shows flavours of sweet blackberry and vanilla, with a hint of bitter herbs.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Aromas of Chambord, butterscotch and sage leaf emanate from the glass. title: Famille Fabre Le Cerf et le Vigneron Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Famille Fabre has been owned and operated by the same family since 1605. The oldest independent wine producer in Languedoc is now under the stewardship of Clémence Fabre, who represents the family's sixteenth generation. A great value, this wine has quite an elegant character, with ample dark fruit and spice. Perfect for grilled meats or mushroom burgers.

title: Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Building on the house style, Winemaker Kevin Hall has done it again. 95% cab is layered with touches of merlot, while hints of cab franc, malbec and petit verdot add fruit notes and seamless complexity. The '94 still had remnants of fruit and showed great structure - patience was rewarded here. The 2020 has beautiful dark fruit notes, firm tannins and a rich, elegant finish. Score - 97. (Kyle Swartz, beveragedynamics.com, Jan. 2, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Wonderfully fruited and perfumed, the wine shows dark plum, blueberry, floral, olive and toasted almond characters, leading to a gorgeously rounded palate that's ripe and flavoursome. raw_ec_shortdesc: Syrah and Grenache grapes are handpicked, fully destemmed, and undergo malolactic fermentation. It is aged in oak barrels for nine months, while 40% stays in stainless steel. title: Austin Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 harvest was slightly later than is typical. The individual lots for this wine were aged separately in French and American oak before being combined in September 2022. The final blending and bottling took place in mid-November 2022. This rich, juicy wine has intense black fruit, coffee, smoke and vanilla, with a lifted spice. Enjoy it through 2027.

title: Calcu Tiny Blocks Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The granitic soils of Marchigüe in western Colchagua usually provide firm tannins that can often only be tamed with a few years in the bottle. And those palate-prickling tannins are strongly felt here in this cabernet from vineyards planted in 2007, although fortunately, there's more to it than that. Ripe red fruits and herbal touches unfurl gracefully in a wine that would go very well with game meat. This red was aged for 12 months in barrels. [A wine with the potential to see 2030+.] Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)

title: Finca Feliz Tesoro Criolla Grande 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The grapes for this wine come from 12-year-old vines, which are young in a Criolla context, since most of the grape's plantings are around 40 years old and some reported to be over 200. Fermented and aged in concrete, it's a lithe, food-friendly red, with red cherry, earth and mineral tones. Though certainly its own creature, this is reminiscent of Gamay or Pinot Noir.

title: Paul Hobbs Coombsville Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is the first vintage for this label. In fact, this replaces the 'Napa Valley' label, but since all the wine now comes from the Coombsville AVA (and mostly from their estate), it now carries the Coombsville name. Deep garnet-purple in color, the nose of the 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon Coombsville is redolent of Morello cherries, boysenberries and cassis with hints of lilacs, cinnamon stick and dried herbs. The medium to full-bodied palate has vibrant black fruit flavors with a soft texture and nice tension, finishing with a red fruit lift. Drink date: 2021-2036. Score - 94+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Feb. 26, 2021)

title: Arnaud de Villeneuve N° 153 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Back label description is spot on, telling us grenache and syrah get together for 'smooth and refined tannic structure' from 'dark fruit, liquorice and spice.' Truth to those tidbits but also expressly classic and idiomatic Côtes De Roussillon, captured at a mere 13.5 percent alcohol which is so welcome in these paradoxical days of climate crisis and roses. By the way Arnaud de Villeneuve is the author of a collection of aphorisms, gathered in the very famous 'Parabolae Medicationis.' And so the maxim 'if it ain't broke, why fix it' would appropriately apply to this red blend, expressed, caught and suspended in time. Drink 2023-2026. Tasted June 2023. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Back label description is spot on, telling us grenache and syrah get together for 'smooth and refined tannic structure' from 'dark fruit, liquorice and spice.' Truth to those tidbits but also expressly classic and idiomatic Côtes De Roussillon, captured at a mere 13.5 percent alcohol which is so welcome in these paradoxical days of climate crisis and roses. By the way Arnaud de Villeneuve is the author of a collection of aphorisms, gathered in the very famous 'Parabolae Medicationis.' And so the maxim 'if it ain't broke, why fix it' would appropriately apply to this red blend, expressed, caught and suspended in time. Drink 2023-2026. Tasted June 2023. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)
raw_sysconcepts: red blend ; ain't broke ; Parabolae Medicationis ; climate crisis ; idiomatic Côtes ; expressly classic ; dark fruit ; tannic structure ; collection of aphorisms

title: Mosquita Muerta Pispi Red Blend 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The elegant and balanced 2018 Pispi is a blend of 40% Malbec, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Bonarda, 10% Petit Verdot and 10% Cabernet Franc sourced from different parts of Mendoza and produced in a very harmonious way. It combines ripeness with freshness, power with subtleness. It has terrific balance and integration of all the components, coming through as subtle and clean, focused and tasty. Excellent! Drink date: 2021-2025. Score - 92+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, March 31, 2021)

title: Lafazanis Geometria Agiorgitiko 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The most important grape of the Neméa PDO, Agiorgitiko (ah-your-YEE-tee-koh) is a bit of a chameleon, able to produce soft, fruity rosés, stunning dessert wines, and smooth, deep reds. This example from Lafazanis offers notes of freshly picked red berry and plum with distinct undertones of black licorice and ground nutmeg.

title: Georgian Royal Wine GRW Mukuzani Dry Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a very deeply coloured red with a smooth, pronounced nose of very ripe black plum/blackberry, violet, vague pepper and spice. Reminds me of Cotes du Rhone. It is medium-full bodied, quite well rounded and balanced with good acid-alcohol dimension and soft tannin. There is some minerality as well. The length is very good. Tasted January 2024. Score - 88. title: Merayo Las Tres Filas Mencia 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: 100% Mencia. Our Best in Show journey across Northern Spain continues with a 2020 Bierzo, grown just across the provincial border from Galicia into Castilla y Léon. It's another zone of steep slopes and old vines - the variety in this case being Mencia (known as Jaen in Portugal's Dão region). This wine is deep black-red in colour and vivacious and urgent in aroma: wild plums mingled with the woodland scents of leaf, copse and forest floor. The palate is fruit-packed and vibrant, vigorous with an energy derived both from ripe acidity and fresh though smooth tannins; look out, too, for a stony, bitter-edged finish perhaps derived from the region's slate soils. Wonderful drinking now in the flush of youth, but fruit of this quality will hold well for a few years yet. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2023)

title: Clos de Caveau Fruit Sauvage Vacqueyras 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Purity, freshness and aromatic precision - a promising start. Full-bodied, rounded, generous and fruity. Feels very Vacqueyras and has really punchy acidity to match the rich fruit. The alcohol is balanced, higher than most in this low-alcohol vintage. Long finish. Excellent. Indigenous yeasts, spends 50 days in tank. Drinking window: 2023-2030. Score - 93. (Matt Walls, decanter.com, Dec. 15, 2022)

title: Toasted Head Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Toasted Head' refers to the way in which this wine is matured, in barrels with toasted heads and staves. Pairs well with grilled meats, and sharp cheeses.

title: Domaine Le Champs des Murailles La Petite Muraille 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This delicious wine, hailing from the Languedoc region of France, is a blend of 40% grenache noir, 30% carignan, 30% cinsault. It offers up a fascinating nose of cherry jam, strawberry, dried herbs, and mocha. Wonderfully juicy with smooth tannins and a medium body. Flavours of cherry and blackberry are prominent, with the blackberry lingering wonderfully in the finish. At this price, you are going to want more than one bottle. Pair with grilled ribs basted with a tangy bbq sauce. Score - 92. (Dave Isaacs, winecurrent.com, April 11, 2023)

title: H.J. Fabre Reserva Cabernet Franc 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fabre buys grapes for this cabernet franc from the Alto Agrelo zone, about 1,100 meters above sea level and toward the beginning of the Andean foothills. It's a 100% cabernet franc from 20-year-old vines planted on alluvial soils. It has herbal aromas that combine with ripe red fruits in a wine whose palate shows its claws, with firm and reactive tannins surrounded by flavors of juicy fruit. Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)

title: Vietti Castiglione Barolo 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is the most accessible Barolo from Vietti and the wine that casts the biggest net in terms of fruit sourcing from across many MGA sites. The 2019 Barolo Castiglione is a layered and generous wine that reflects the main takeaways offered by this very successful vintage. In fact, because this wine is not from a single site, it speaks more to the quality of the vintage than it does to any one specific vineyard. The Castiglione reveals generous richness and concentrated cherry fruit with dark saturation and good structure that comes from the thicker skins developed on Nebbiolo grapes this year. It concludes with a salty mineral note that adds focus and elegance. Drink date: 2024-2040. Score - 95. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Aug. 24, 2023)

title: The Tragically Hip Fifty Mission Cab Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon with a small amount of Merlot from two select vineyards in the Niagara Peninsula. Grapes were crushed and fermented in one tonne fermenter bins with daily manual punch-down of the caps. The wine was then racked into French oak barrels (30% new barrels, 40% 1 year old, 30 % seasoned) for 12 months prior to blending. Hip fans will be gobbling up these wines up quickly, but I hope they will take the time to enjoy the bottles rather than keep them as souvenirs. it really is a nice red wine to drink. It has a fairly robust nose of blackberries, dark cherries, dried tobacco, violets, plums and toasted oak spice notes. It's rich and smooth on the palate with ripe dark berries, a touch of cherry compote, cassis, Cuban tobacco and earthy notes with lovely integrated spice notes and mouth-watering acidity driving the back end. A really fine Cabernet with classic Niagara elegance and enough stuffing to cellar 5+ years, though attractive right now. Better hurry if you want any of this special wine. Go Leafs Go! Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Nov. 28, 2023)

title: Viña Casablanca Itera Seaside Journey 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: New to the Viña Casablanca range in 2021 - and further evidence that the bodega is pushing a few boundaries - this is a Pacific Ocean-influenced cuvée of mostly Pinot Noir with 40%Merlot, Barbera and Grenache. Clay amphora, concrete tank and old barrel-aged components combine attractively here, producing a wine that is savoury, grippy and perfumed, with some whole bunch spice and flavours of black cherry and raspberry. Drink date: 2023-2029. Score - 93. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2023)

title: Solicantus Melodie du Sol 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Located at the bottom of the Gironde Estuary, Solicantus sources grapes from the hills of Blaye at a high elevation to evade the early-morning fogs. title: Casa Bauza Presumido 2020

title: Clos Dubreuil 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2015 Clos Dubreuil is a blend of 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in 100% new French oak over the next 20 months. It has a delightful bouquet of hoisin and redcurrant, beautifully defined with an attractive marine influence coming through with aeration. The palate is medium-bodied with steely tannin, very focused with a brisk and vibrant finish that seems more precise than previous vintages, with a dash of white pepper on the aftertaste. This is serious Saint Emilion that is for long-term ageing. Bon vin! Drink date: 2021-2040. Score - 92-94. (Neal Martin, robertparker.com, April 27, 2016)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2015 Clos Dubreuil is a blend of 80% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in 100% new French oak over the next 20 months. title: Château Pape Clément 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Ranking with the top wines of the vintage, the dense purple-hued 2020 Château Pape Clement offers a sensational bouquet of pure crème de cassis interwoven with notes of liquid violets and classy oak. Possessing flawless balance, full-bodied richness, and ultra-fine tannins, it excels in this vintage and has a pretty, elegant, yet also layered and concentrated profile. It will drink well with just short-term cellaring yet evolve gracefully for 20-30 years. I was able to taste this on multiple occasions, and it always checked in near the upper end of the scale. This is a gorgeous wine in the making. Score - 97-99. (jebdunnuck.com, May 23, 2021)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Ranking with the top wines of the vintage, the dense purple-hued 2020 Château Pape Clement offers a sensational bouquet of pure crème de cassis interwoven with notes of liquid violets and classy oak. title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Juicy, well balanced, plenty of personality, with enough juice through the mid palate to balance out the big tannins that are pretty inescapable in any wines of ambition in 2020. The finish closes in sharply, but this is an enjoyable wine from the Lorenzetti-owned Lilian Ladouys (and for me one of the clear leaders of the new Cru Bourgeois Exceptionnel category). 35% new oak, harvest September 15 to 30, 78% first wine. Drinking window: 2026-2040. Score - 93. (Jane Anson, decanter.com, March 16, 2023)

title: Orso Bruno Old Vine Zinfandel
raw_ec_shortdesc: In Italy, the Zinfandel grape is commonly referred to as Primitivo. It is known for producing smooth, fruit-forward red wines. Orso Bruno Old Vine Zinfandel is packed with ripe fruit flavours of plum and raspberry supported by notes of spice and chocolate. It pairs well with saucy barbecue, making it a perfect summer wine.

title: Carus Robèo Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is an organically grown cabernet, with a nicely lifted, pure if jammy nose of blackcurrant, rosemary/tarragon herbality, enhanced by fine oak toast. It is medium weight, firm and almost sinewy in cabernet's inimitable way. It is also juicy on the palate with good acidity and considerable chewy tannin. Almost sappy, with some minerality. Excellent length. I like the energy here. Tasted December 2023. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)

title: Baileyana Firepeak Pinot Noir 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Longtime winemaker Rob Takigawa only shows more experience each vintage on this relatively affordable bottling. Aromas of black cherry and black raspberry meet with vanilla and pie crust on the delicious nose. The palate lands with ripe cherry compote and strawberry sorbet flavors, but the intrigue is added by mint leaf and a firm tannic frame. Editors' Choice. Score - 92. (Matt Kettman, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2022)

title: Villa Puccini Toscana IGT Governo Toscano
raw_ec_shortdesc: This blend of Sangiovese, Ciliegiolo and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes is vinified using the Governo method. title: Volcanic Hills Magma Red 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is sourced from Volcanic Hills's own estate vineyards in West Kelowna as well as from select growers in Osoyoos. title: Nestor Zweigelt Neusiedlersee DAC 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made using Zweigelt grapes picked from 30-year-old vines, this wine is fresh with aromas of dark plums and cherries with light notes of vanilla and sandalwood. title: Cave De Lugny Bourgogne Pinot Noir AOC
raw_ec_shortdesc: Cave de Lugny, established in the late 1800s, is a cooperative of Burgundian grape growers producing red, white and sparkling wines. title: Avondale Qvevri 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 2018 Avondale's Johnathan Grieve poured test tube samples drawn from Qvevri and now in 2022 the third iteration really begins to show his in depth understanding of the process. Red is a Rhône blend, grenache driven, with mourvèdre and syrah under a submerged cap, 60 per cent whole bunch, carbonic maceration and spontaneous fermentation. Heads through punchdown and is left on skins post ferment for 30-60 days, depending on the Qvevri. It's almost Beaujolais style albeit with longer Piedmontese-esque soaks. The goal and credible arrival at fruition is more tannin by skins in extraction, earthiness from the clay but bright fruit all in. The tannins are chalky chewy and overall the wine remains really bright and effusive. Please serve this chilled. Drink 2023-2026. Tasted October 2022. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: In 2018 Avondale's Johnathan Grieve poured test tube samples drawn from Qvevri and now in 2022 the third iteration really begins to show his in depth understanding of the process. Red is a Rhône blend, grenache driven, with mourvèdre and syrah under a submerged cap, 60 per cent whole bunch, carbonic maceration and spontaneous fermentation. Heads through punchdown and is left on skins post ferment for 30-60 days, depending on the Qvevri. It's almost Beaujolais style albeit with longer Piedmontese-esque soaks. The goal and credible arrival at fruition is more tannin by skins in extraction, earthiness from the clay but bright fruit all in. title: Vitis Unica Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: An expressive cabernet with a mixture of red and black fruit with some baking spices and grilled herbs. Lots of cherries and currants. Medium- to full-bodied on the palate, but really crunchy and drinkable with tight but chalky tannins. Impressive freshness from the acidity and the fruit. A wine you'd want to drink immediately, but it will age, too. Score - 93. (Zekun Shuai, jamessuckling.com, April 24, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Made with a blend of grape varietals, Aragonez, Tricadeira, Touriga National and Syrah. title: Haywire Secrest Mountain Pinot Noir 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This comes off their organically farmed Secrest Mountain Vineyard, a higher altitude site with calcium-carbonate laced alluvial and gravelled soils. This was native fermented, 50% whole cluster, with 4 weeks skin contact in concrete and stainless before basket pressing into concrete for 10 months. Wild plum, cherry, perfumed raspberry flood this lifted pinot, seasoned with scrubby desert shrubs and pink peppercorn, and hugged with finely grippy tannins through a textured, lingering finish. Beauty. Score - 91. (Treve Ring, gismondionwine.com, Oct. 21, 2022)

title: St. Hugo Grenache/Shiraz/Mataro 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: 62/31/7% grenache/shiraz/mataro, the majority 70+yo vines; 16% whole bunches, 12% carbonic maceration; matured in old French oak for 8 months. Vivid red purple in the glass, super-ripe plum and blueberry notes are led by wafts of frangipani over a base of exotic spice, amaro herbs, licorice, earth and cherry danish. A very modern, juicy take on the classic blend, with pure, juicy fruit, tight ripe tannin and a finish that lingers beautifully. It's just great, spicy drinking. Drink by: 2032. Special Value. Score - 96. (Dave Brookes, winecompanion.com.au, March 28, 2022)

title: Mauritson Positas Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: Positas is a gravelly loam formed in alluvial material, most commonly known as 'benchland.' 2016 Positas Cabernet Sauvignon (100% Cabernet) was aged 22 months in French oak. It has a deep ruby-purple color and scents of dark chocolate-covered cherries, pencil shavings, red cherry sparks, iron and beef drippings plus dried herbs and leather hints. The palate is medium to full-bodied with lifted, mineral-tinged fruits with firm, lightly chalky tannins and good freshness, finishing long and minerally. Very pretty. This should age very well in bottle. Drink date: 2020-2040.  Score - 94. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, Dec. 19, 2019)

title: Dios Ares Crianza 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2018 Ares Crianza is quite different from the one from the new project, Voelos, which is more traditional. This is still Tempranillo from the Sonsierra, matured in French barriques for 12 months but in a completely different style - here, the fruit takes the leading role. This is a super-drinkable style of Crianza, with the oak in the background (or even further back...) with clean fruit and a vibrant palate with great freshness. This is perfect by the glass and with food. Drink date: 2020-2024. Score - 91. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Oct. 30, 2020)

title: Domaine Fond Croze Le Serre de la Garde Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from organically grown grenache (70%) and syrah (30%) that come together here to produce a lovely, soft-textured wine that's flavourful and well structured. The nicely layered flavours are mainly dark fruit, and they're balanced by well-calibrated acidity that has an attractive edginess. There's a little grip left in the tannins, but they are essentially resolved. It's drinking very well now and will hold another six years or so.  Score - 92. (Rod Phillips, Sept. 2023)

title: Luciano Arduini Costelonghe Valpolicella Classico Superiore 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: This blend of 50% Corvina, 30% Corvinone and 20% Rondinella from 30-year-old vines was aged for 18 months. Half the wine was aged in cement and half in old large oak barrels, elevating the aromatics while also imparting fine oak spice tones. Look for notes of cherry, dark fruit, vanilla, clove and forest floor and enjoy through 2026+. [Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 98. (lucamaroni.com, Sept. 2, 2022)

title: Shaw & Smith Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a beautiful release of Shaw + Smith Shiraz. It's even-handed and well tempered but then it's all joy from there. A forest of berries, a walk through flowers, peppers flung through and rubs of woodsy spice; the combination of fruitiness, savouriness, seriousness and fun is a highway to pleasure, built on wine. For all that the tannin is another dimension in itself; fine, lacy, assertive and savoury at once, complete with its own twiggy spice notes. It's drinking beautifully and it will continue to do so. Drink: 2024-2036+. Score - 96. (Campbell Mattinson, winefront.com.au, Oct. 21, 2022)

title: Silkwood Estate The Walcott Single Vineyard Shiraz 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: It's a savoury, clovey, nutty style of shiraz with (black) cherry-plum fruit flavours running through its heart. Both twig and reductive characters act as complexing agents and the finish is decidedly herbal, though it's not hard or unripe; it flows. Complexity is clearly this wine's strong suit. Over the medium term it should develop well. Drink by: 2030. Score - 92. (Campbell Mattinson, winecompanion.com.au, June 21, 2021)

title: Franzia Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: California's Franzia has mastered wine packaging and the 'positive flow' of wine: no oxygen can enter, which preserves freshness. Savour this full-bodied wine for up to six weeks! Enticing aromas of red fruit, jam and vanilla, backed by balanced tannins and a dry finish. Enjoy with burgers served with coleslaw and beans.

title: Vistamar Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: One of the best-kept secrets about Chilean cabernet is the result that this variety offers in the foothills of the Andes, at the level of the Cachapoal Valley - fine, sharp cabernets like this one. Despite the season's warmth, this shows its herbal side and the red fruit tones that are mixed with black fruits and sweeter touches. A succulent and friendly mountain wine. Score - 92. title: Umani Ronchi Cúmaro Conero Riserva 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sage and cocoa complement plum and cherry sauce aromas as the 2019 Conero Riserva Cumaro smolders up from the glass. It's silky smooth with polished red fruits and an interplay of savory and sweet as hints of sour citrus mingle with confectionary spice. It finishes structured, leaving woodgrained tannins and a cheek-puckering tension as tart wild berries and espresso bean suggestions fade. While I prefer a bit less wood influence, the 2019 Cumaro is beautifully balanced and should integrate nicely over the coming years [but can be served tonight after an hour in the decanter]. Drinking window: 2026-2033. Score - 92. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, May 2, 2024)

title: Colio Reserve Merlot 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Colio's Reserve merlot from an exceptional vintage in Niagara-on-the-Lake features generous and appealing perfume. A lush and fleshy incarnation, texturally appealing and approachable with memorable juiciness. The tannins offer a light grip and add volume to the palate. Notes of raspberry and black plum with cocoa and tobacco lingering on the finish of very good length. An honest and noteworthy expression of the grape variety picked at the peak of ripeness. A much-improved bottle than first tasted in January. Re-tasted June 2022. Gold Medal winner with a combined rating of 92 points at the 2022 National Wine Awards of Canada. Score - 91. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)

title: Krutz Beckstoffer Georges III Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon Beckstoffer Vineyard Georges III is 100% Cabernet that spent 22 months in 90% new French oak. This is a historic, larger vineyard, and the 2018 has a great nose of ripe, darker fruits, caramelized redcurrants, incense, and spice. I love its complexity, and it hits the palate with medium to full-bodied richness, a round, elegant texture, moderate tannins, and beautiful length on the finish. A classic, impeccably made wine, it will evolve for 20 years or more. Maturity: 2021-2042. Score - 96. (jebdunnuck.com, Jan. 27, 2021)

title: Matilda Nieves Mencía 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: 85% Mencia, 8% Garnacha, 7% Sousón. Anyone who has ever seen photographs of the steep slopes of Ribeira Sacra will wonder how it is possible to produce a wine like this in our Value category - but here it is, dark, fresh and thrillingly aromatic from first sniff to last swallow. This limpid, unoaked wine is made from the Mencia grape variety (known as Jaen in Portugal) plus a little Garnacha and Souson, and the emphasis is on its sloe, bramble and damson fruits in all their primary glory, almost as if it had been run from the vats just a week or two earlier. The palate is soft-textured, mouth-filling, exuberant and comely, structured more prominently by acidity than tannin, though that acidity is sweet and juicy in its own right. There is nothing at all sharp or hard about this tender, almost lip-smacking red... yet the variety itself, and the legacy of its austere, granite-soiled origins, somehow contrive to stop the wine tasting simple. Platinum. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2021)

title: Sassicaia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Here it is: A quintessential Sassicaia that represents the excellence of the vintage and also respects the unique taste profile of this distinguished Tuscan blend of Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc. The Tenuta San Guido 2021 Bolgheri Sassicaia offers impeccable balance, excellent freshness and absolutely no signs of over-ripeness. The fruit balance is ideal with a hint of crunch and lasting tension from pulp and skins. The tannins are deftly managed with firm grip and enough velvetiness to add volume and length. There is no greenness on the bouquet that instead offers mulled herbs and spice, with cinnamon and clove, layered delicately between mostly red and some purple berry fruits. Redcurrant, blueberry, sweet pomegranate and Rainier cherry run strong in this vintage. A fragrant hint of heritage rose emerges with time. The oak tones are geared toward gingerbread, hazelnut, cigar, sandalwood and something like a grilled sweet red pepper. To the palate, it offers nice weight with no heavy glycerin, and a rinse of acidity that adds to the wine's natural energy, brightness and viscosity. That marked freshness opens the wine up to long aging potential, but you still need to give it more time in bottle. Drink date: 2028-2060. Score - 100. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Jan. 4, 2024)

title: Leaning Post Cuvée Winona 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Merlot for this blend was fermented in an open-top stainless steel tank while the Cabernet was fermented in concrete. Both were aged in oak barrels for one year before being blended, unfined and unfiltered, in May of 2022. The result is a ripe, broad-shouldered wine with lifted floral tones atop cassis, blackberry, raspberry, savoury Cab Franc herbal notes, chocolate, and a characterful graphite-edged minerality.

title: Robert Mondavi Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Composed of 92% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Merlot, 2% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc, the 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon To Kalon Reserve features a deep garnet-purple color and wonderfully expressive nose of crème de cassis, preserved plums and black forest cake with hints of cigar boxes, aniseed, dark chocolate and forest floor. title: Ballentine Reserve Zinfandel 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Composed of 96% Zinfandel, 3% Malbec and 1% Petit Verdot, the 2019 Zinfandel Reserve has a medium garnet-purple in color. It rolls effortlessly out of the glass with notes of stewed raspberries and cherries with hints of Chinese five spice and hoisin, plus touches of tobacco and dusty soil. The full-bodied palate is chock-full of spicy black and red berry flavors with a chewy texture and oodles of freshness, finishing long and lifted. Drink date: 2021-2029. Score - 92. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 29, 2021)

title: Robert Mondavi Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Another wine that shows the quality of the vintage to a T is the 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve. It has undeniable class and finesse as well as medium to full body, a perfumed, complex array of cassis and dark fruits, tobacco, and violets, silky tannins, no hard edges, and a great finish. This isn't a blockbuster but a wine that builds beautifully with time in the glass and will reward 4-5 years of bottle age and have 20-30 years of overall longevity. The blend of the 2018 is 93% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc, and the rest Petit Verdot, all aged 20 months in new French oak, but it seems to have absorbed every ounce, as it's undetectable. It's a brilliant, quintessential Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. Maturity: 2025-2056. Score - 97+. (jebdunnuck.com, Aug. 5, 2021)

title: Château Musar Red 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2017 Château Musar has a perfumed bouquet with well-defined plummy red fruit, fireside embers and pressed flower scents. A hint of VA in the background gives the aromatics a welcome kick. The palate is medium-bodied with fine tannins and well-judged acidity, harmonious, not powerful, yet full of flavor. A pleasing bitterness surfaces towards the finish, with moderate persistence and a residual white pepper tang lingering in the mouth. Very nice. Drinking window: 2023-2040. Score - 90. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, April 3, 2023)

title: Rhys Alpine Hillside Pinot Noir 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: I always find the Hillside releases to be similar to the base release yet always with more density and depth. Some years the differences are easy to spot, some years, not so much. In 2017, the differences between the base cuvée and the Hillside are easy to spot. The 2017 Pinot Noir Alpine Vineyard Hillside is a clear step up over the base cuvée and, I'd wager, one of the Pinot Noirs of the vintage. Sporting a deeper ruby color (it's deeper colored than the base release), it displays awesome notes of spiced black cherries, mulberries, sassafras, sagebrush, mint, and forest floor. Deep, medium to full-bodied, flawlessly balanced, and with both power and elegance, it's a brilliant effort from the Santa Cruz Mountain that offers just about everything you could want from Pinot Noir. It has some upfront appeal yet is going to benefit from 2-4 years of bottle age and cruise of 15+ years in cool cellars. Maturity: 2021-2036. Score - 98. (jebdunnuck.com, Oct. 31, 2019)

title: Château Margaux 1995
raw_ec_shortdesc: This still broods seriously, with dark plum, currant and blackberry fruit, studded with charcoal, singed tobacco and cedar notes and backed by a serious grip of roasted earth. The gorgeously long finish is driven by old-school tannins, with the smoldering edge going on and on. A brick house of a Margaux, with more charcoal than graphite, more austerity than elegance and more power than refinement. - Non-blind Château Margaux vertical (December 2013). Drink now through 2034. Ranked #2 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 1998.  Score - 97. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Nov. 30, 2014)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This still broods seriously, with dark plum, currant and blackberry fruit, studded with charcoal, singed tobacco and cedar notes and backed by a serious grip of roasted earth. The gorgeously long finish is driven by old-school tannins, with the smoldering edge going on and on. A brick house of a Margaux, with more charcoal than graphite, more austerity than elegance and more power than refinement. - Non-blind Château Margaux vertical (December 2013). Drink now through 2034. Ranked #2 in Wine Spectator's Top 100 Wines of 1998.  Score - 97. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, Nov. 30, 2014)

title: Southbrook Triomphe Gamay 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This vegan-friendly wine underwent a wild ferment on its skins for 14 days before ageing for nine months in neutral French oak. The result is a lithe, supple wine bursting with surprisingly intense character given the delicacy of the framing. Strawberry rhubarb pie, cherry, cranberry, raspberry and redcurrant launch from the glass like a rocket ship wrapped in a ribbon.

title: San Pedro 1865 Selected Vineyards Carmenère 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The nose is recognizably carmenere, with herbal notes that add a layer of freshness, behind that, aromas of ripe red fruit and some spices. The palate is brimming with fruit flavors, and this time the herbs are very subtle, like background music. The tannins are smooth and polished and there are light mineral touches towards the finish on the palate. This carmenere is an excellent example of the variety and comes from the Lolol zone, in the western Colchagua Valley. It was aged for a year in barrels. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The nose is recognizably carmenere, with herbal notes that add a layer of freshness, behind that, aromas of ripe red fruit and some spices. title: Villa Pinciana Terraria 2013
raw_ec_shortdesc: 45% Sangiovese, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot. Very Bordeaux in style, with cassis, red and black fruit, plus a hint of green savoury herbs. The wood integrates well and the red berry fruit becomes more concentrated on the mid-palate. Buoyant with flavour and textural through the long and rich finish. An ageing vinous beauty, with plenty of life left. [Drink through 2025.] Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: La Pieve Barolo 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 vintage in Barolo produced classically styled wines with a touch more approachability and exuberance than, say, the comparably austere 2019 vintage. title: Damjanic Borgonja 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Borgonja is the local name for Blaufränkisch. The wine is ruby red in colour, on the nose intense fruit aroma of currant and raspberry, violet flowers. On the pallet we have refreshing acidity and at the end red pepper and paprika. Overall, fruity taste with herbal notes of clove. Tannins are soft and the wine is very elegant and well balanced. Gastro recommendation: pasta with meat sauce, scrambled eggs with sausage. It blends elegantly with grilled sardines, black risotto, salami, prosciutto and medium-aged cheeses.

title: Tessellae Old Vines Grenache/Syrah/Mourvèdre

Try it with a charcuterie platter or grilled lamb.

title: Château Magnol 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lovely weight and expression on the palate, a good juicy core that strikes just the right balance between high acidity giving freshness and life and ripeness of fruit which gives body and structure. Excellent vein of cooling minty freshness throughout which lingers long on the palate. This has a really lovely sugary hit on the mid palate too which is so appealing. Lots of nice elements here. Will be excellent in time. Not for long ageing, drinking young and enjoy the exuberance. Good extraction on show I think. Drinking window: 2024-2030. Score - 91. (Georgina Hindle, decanter.com, June 5, 2022)

title: Le Clos Jordanne Jordan Village Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a perfumed and poised, yet flavourful and structured example of Ontario pinot noir, made by talented and passionate winemaker, Thomas Bachelder. Oak-derived spices are seamlessly woven into a silken palate infused with fleshy red berries, dark cherries, dried herbs, and the beguiling scent of fresh magnolias. This is a wine that is already balanced and integrated, though it will benefit from a year or two in the cellar. The finish is long and intense, ending on a spice-infused note. Tasted April 2024. Score - 92. (Megha Jandhyala, winealign.com)

title: Tignanello 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: First made in 1971, this legendary Italian wine now celebrates its 50th birthday. Happy Birthday, Tignanello! The Marchesi Antinori 2021 Tignanello (made with 79% Sangiovese, 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Cabernet Franc) pulls on all the heartstrings. To be released in May, the wine shows a quintessentially pretty taste profile with tart fruit flavors, redcurrant, tea leaf, heritage rose, crushed white pepper, licorice, nutmeg, clove and chopped mint. It opens slowly to reveal more richness and exuberance with time, becoming downright voluptuous and heady a short while later. The through line, however, remains the bright freshness and minerality of Sangiovese. Compared to the 2018 vintage (which I also loved), this vintage has more overall fruit weight and volume. Drink date: 2025-2048. Score - 98. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, March 21, 2024)

title: Remo Farina Ripasso Valpolicella Classico Superiore 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Remo Farina Superiore 2019 Ripasso Valpolicella is a crowd-pleaser Classico and great value under $20. Rich, juicy and smooth on the palate, this medium-plus-bodied Veneto red is produced from 50% Corvina, 15% Corvinone, 20% Rondinella, 5% Molinara and 10% Oseleta. Look for dark cherry, sweet dried tobacco leaf, cracked pepper and baking spice flavours on the palate. Pour with grilled eggplant, roasted red pepper and buffalo mozzarella paninis. Drink: 2021-2027. Score - 91. (nataliemaclean.com, Dec. 19, 2021)

title: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia Reserva 2012
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2012 Viña Tondonia Reserva comes from a very dry year, with 25% less rain than the average (at the time), resulting in lower yields of very healthy grapes that delivered wines with nice balance between alcohol and polyphenols, making it very apt for the aging in barrel. It had a slightly longer élevage in barrel, six years. The wine is aromatic with a developed profile, spicy and tertiary (forest floor, a touch of brick dust and iodine), complex and nuanced. The palate is full and round, with polished tannins and a long, dry finish. It has a textbook Tondonia nose and profile. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 29, 2024)

title: Mastroberardino Irpinia Aglianico 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Founded in 1878, Mastroberardino is synonymous with fine wine in Campania. They're a member of the Grandi Marchi: an organization of Italy's most important winemaking families and producers that collectively represent more than 3,000 years of winemaking history. Mastroberardino's wines speak to tradition and excellence as few can. The robust, intense cherry, blackberry and spice in this Aglianico will evolve into the early 2030s.

title: Errázuriz KAI Carmenère 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: There's a delicious briny quality to this wine hailing from a balanced vintage in which freshness and depth work in perfect counterpoint. Vibrant and characterful with smoked paprika, roasted peppers, wild oregano and rocket, piercing a deep layer of plum, fresh figs and black and green olives. Lovely perfumed notes (sandal, incense) play in the background. Beautiful, chiselled tannins. Long finish with lingering pink and white pepper, roasted coffee beans, fig leaf, and a zesty tail of pink grapefruit. Drinking window: 2024-2041. Score - 95. (Ines Salpico, decanter.com, April 26, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: There's a delicious briny quality to this wine hailing from a balanced vintage in which freshness and depth work in perfect counterpoint. title: Ricasoli Rocca Guicciarda Riserva Chianti Classico
raw_ec_shortdesc: Barone Ricasoli is the oldest winery in Italy. It is here, in 1872, that the blend for Chianti was created. This one is ripe and layered, with red fruit, chestnut, floral notes, cedar and a fresh, food-friendly acidity. Pair this classic with another: try a Tuscan slow-simmered ragu al chingiale, or your favourite meaty pasta.

title: Undurraga T.H. Syrah 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Undurraga's brilliant Leyda Valley Syrah is always among the best examples of the variety in Chile. Sourced from a very densely planted, dry-farmed 3.11-hectare block planted with the 174 and 470 clones, it has aromas of pine and laurel, layers of inky, crunchy fig and blackberry fruit, grippy tannins and a peppery lift. Drink date: 2024-2032. Score - 96. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2022)

title: Carpineto Farnito Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: This supple, black currant-, blackberry-, iron-, olive- and cedar-infused red shows its Tuscan roots as well as good varietal character. title: Fontanafredda Serralunga d'Alba Barolo 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: From 18 different areas within the Comune, the medium red 2020 Barolo Del Comune Di Serralunga D'Alba offers spicy notes of fresh cherries, raspberries, rosemary, incense, and orange peel. Medium-bodied and elegant, it's approachable now, with ripe tannins and very harmonious, savory notes of pure tea leaf on the finish. Very well-styled, it has a good sense of the village it hails from as well as the finesse this vintage offers. Drink it over the next 10-12 years. Maturity: 2024-2036. Score - 92. (Audrey Frick, jebdunnuck.com, May 13, 2024)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Tart and fresh aromas of red plum, strawberry and lightly toasted sage and marjoram draw the nose into this zesty, widely available bottling. (Matt Kettman, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2023)

title: Silver Oak Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Aged in 50% new and 50% second-use American Oak from the Duncan family's The Oak cooperage in Higbee, Missouri. Matt Duncan joined me for my tasting, and he says the Petit Verdot in the blend, of which there is 0.4%, is co-fermented with the Cabernet Sauvignon, intended to bring focus to the Cabernet fruit. A compelling, brooding, muscular rendition of Cabernet from Alexander Valley with gorgeous boysenberry notes, black currants, and rose petals laced with vanillin notes and toasty oak. Medium to full-bodied with black currants, ripe blackberry and black cherry notes framed by velvety tannins laced with that irresistible vanillin note. Toasty oak spices lend a hint of sweetness, balanced by grippy acidity. Long and complex, revealing umami, garrigue, and crushed slatestone on the finish. It's a terrific wine from the Alexander Valley. Drinking window: 2023-2035. Score - 95. (Jonathan Cristaldi, decanter.com, Oct. 23, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Aged in 50% new and 50% second-use American Oak from the Duncan family's The Oak cooperage in Higbee, Missouri. title: Beni di Batasiolo Nebbiolo 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Piedmont's lofty reputation as one of the world's most prized wine regions is founded upon Nebbiolo. The grape is responsible for two of Italy's greatest wines (Barolo and Barbaresco) and stands alongside only Pinot Noir for its ability to express terroir. Nebbiolo wines from Langhe offer amazing value. Look for raspberry, dried herbs, apple, earth and light oak tones in this wine.

title: Mission Hill Oculus 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: A melding of opulence and elegance, the Oculus, a Bordeaux blend grown organically in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, delivers serious New World fruit with sheer elegance. Strawberries and balsamic announce the aromatics of ample complexity and florality. Dried violets, savoury anise and gravelly dust complete the picture. The palate is gorgeously constructed as tannins and freshness interplay. Fresh mint and pine bough frame strawberries, clove and smoke. Well-knit wild mountain berries, pencil lead, and evergreen tips. Freshness, ripeness and structure come together wonderfully. Drinking window: 2023-2038. Score - 95. (Clive Pursehouse, decanter.com, Oct. 31, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A melding of opulence and elegance, the Oculus, a Bordeaux blend grown organically in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, delivers serious New World fruit with sheer elegance. title: Stratus Wildass Red 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Red is likely to be one of the last you will see of this Stratus label as it has since been eliminated from the portfolio. The '19 mix is cabernet franc, petit verdot, cabernet sauvignon, merlot and sangiovese for a junior case in point to the Grand Vin of similar blending nature. This 2019 is simple and trustworthy, a wine so clean and focused with a distinct raspberry-ness, tart and faintly sweet while lending its emphasis for acidity to prevail. It's also a bit tannic, more than other vintages and so there is some structure and power to this one. It may just age a few more years than most might want to give it credit for. Good swan song if it happens to be the last Wildass Red. Put a few aside. What is there to lose? Drink 2023-2027. Tasted November 2023. Score - 89. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Wynns Coonawarra Estate Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is the 66th vintage of this Australian classic. The first of these was made in 1954 and I am honoured to say that I have been fortunate to have tasted every one of these vintages through various verticals to celebrate milestones. The wine has never looked better from this exceptional Coonawarra vintage. It's classic Coonawarra, medium bodied with delightful regional and varietal characters. Leafy and slightly chalky tannin overlay to the vibrant blackcurrant fruit characters. The tannins are super fine and the oak so well played. Perfumed and alive, this is a wine for extended cellaring if you wish. Drink: 2023-2053. Score - 96. (Ray Jordan, winepilot.com, May 2023)

title: Michele Castellani Cinque Stelle Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: A refined and very silky expression of Amarone with lots of crushed currants and berries that form a tight bead on the the full to medium palate. Delicious to taste, but give it until 2024. Score - 94. (jamessuckling.com, Oct. 22, 2021)

title: Standish The Relic Shiraz/Viognier 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 The Relic Shiraz-Viognier is made with fruit from the Hongell family vineyard in Krondorf, with 15% to 20% whole bunches in the ferment and 1% Viognier skins co-fermented. This is the best I've seen it. There's something about the combination of the hot year and the diminished yields - it has recoiled and recompressed the Viognier on top of and into the Shiraz and brought them into balance/harmony. Beneath its floral and stone fruit guiles is a pool of savory, muscular, red-dirt Shiraz. There is bacon fat and pure berry fruit and spice for days... I've recently looked at a previous vintage of this wine alongside an older but immaculate Chateau d'Ampuis, and while their origins were clear in the glass, the Relic proved an Australian perspective more than relevant. The balance between the varieties - and the classic push/pull of sweet and savory - is more harmonious this year than in any I can remember, and the only thing I am more excited about when I consider this wine is what I will say next year, through the lens of an excellent, cool and elegant year. What a fine pair they will make. Drink date: 2022-2042. Score - 99. (Erin Larkin, robertparker.com, May 12, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2020 The Relic Shiraz-Viognier is made with fruit from the Hongell family vineyard in Krondorf, with 15% to 20% whole bunches in the ferment and 1% Viognier skins co-fermented. title: Josh Reserve North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This Cabernet comprises fruit sourced from prime sites in Napa, Sonoma, Lake County and Mendocino. It's fruit-forward and balanced, with deep, dark ripe cherry and purple fruit embroidered by mint, vanilla, hazelnut and earth, all presented in velvety tannins. A good choice for braised short ribs, sautéed portobello mushrooms, well-seasoned steak, or hard cheeses such as aged cheddar or Gouda.

title: Salentein Reserve Malbec 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Malbec Salentein Reserve is a blend of grapes from Los Árboles and Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley and was aged for 12 months in used French (30%) and American (70%) barrels. Purple in the glass. The no-nonsense nose offers notes of ripe red fruit with a little fresh plum and hints of spice. It's voluminous in the mouth with polished tannins and fruity flavor enlivened by the precise freshness. A rewarding wine. Drinking window: 2022-2029. Score - 90. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Nov. 3, 2022)

title: Heredad de Urueña Santo Terroir Tempranillo 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made solely from tempranillo and aged 10 months in new French and American barrels, this is a delicious wine that has everything going for it. You'll find the flavours rich (but not at all over the top) and layered, with excellent complexity and character. The acidity is perfectly tailored to the fruit and the tannins are well integrated. It's holding its style impressively. Drinking very well now, it looks set to live a vibrant life to the mid-to-late-2020s. Score - 92. (Rod Phillips, undated)

title: Xavier Vignon Lirac 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This vintage is due in Sept 2024 in Ontario. I tasted it with Xavier Vignon months earlier, where, amid several other wines, it showed the lovely rounded, soft yet balanced ambiance I have come to expect of Lirac, a small appellation on the other side of the river from Chateauneuf du Pape. The nose shows generous ripe, strawberry/cherry jam, subtle pepper and florals. It is medium-full bodied with moderated alcohol and very fine, sandy tannin. The length is excellent. No need to age this. Tasted Nov 2023. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This vintage is due in Sept 2024 in Ontario. title: San Pedro Sideral 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sideral is something of a second wine after Altaïr. They share the same origin, but Sideral is a different selection, which this year is 73% cabernet sauvignon, 11% syrah, 9% carmenere, 4% petit verdot, and 3% cabernet franc. The wine was aged for 16 months in oak barrels, 20% of them new, as well as in 2,000-liter foudres. It's usually released a year before Altaïr, and this year, it's a juicy wine full of aromatic notes and flavors of red fruits and herbs (cabernet franc and carmenere undoubtedly put their signature on this vintage) in a body of firm acidity (very much in tune with a cool season like 2021) and fine, sharp tannins. An elegant and subtle wine that will gain in complexity with another four or five years in the bottle. [This will continue to evolve through mid-2030s.]  Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2023)

title: Pesquié Édition 1912m Ventoux 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Already blended but awaiting bottling when I tasted it in July 2023, the tank-aged 2022 Ventoux Edition 1912M is an assemblage of 70% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Cinsault. The nose is vaguely peppery and hints briefly of violets, then it develops more cherries and blackberries, while the palate is medium to full-bodied, round, silky and supple, with ample concentration and a ripe, fruity finish. Fun stuff. Drink date: 2023-2028. Score - 89-91. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 16, 2024)

title: Santa Rita Cavanza Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: Cabernet sauvignon rules the vineyards of Chile, and this wine hails from one of the most prized regions. Aromas of smoky oak and prune spread, with floral, cassis and coffee notes. title: Straccali Chianti DOCG
raw_ec_shortdesc: Since its founding in 1925, Straccali has been a progressive force in Tuscan winemaking.  This unpretentious Chianti delivers classic Chianti flavour, modern flare and exceptional value.  Aromas of red berries, dried herbs, and leather follow through to the palate.  This wine will pair perfectly with roasted meats.

title: Barone Montalto Nero D'Avola Cabernet Sicilia DOC
raw_ec_shortdesc: Blending Sicily's Nero d'Avola with Cabernet Sauvignon creates a wine with Old World pedigree and New World flare. The earthy tannins of the Cabernet Sauvignon support the ripe fruit character of the Nero d'Avola. On the palate, expect notes of coffee, plum and spice. This wine will pair well with pasta in a beefy sauce.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Though Malbec may be Argentina's signature grape, Cabernet Sauvignon continues to thrive in the country's rocky elevations. title: MontGras Antu Single Vineyard Carmenère 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The MontGras team use raw material from the Las Cabras parcel in Peumo to produce this varietal Carmenère. It's very much a reflection of the bodega's new style, with ageing infoudres and older barrels. Sappy, textured and floral with easy-going concentration, blackcherry, plum and fennel flavours and a leafy undertone. Drink date: 2025-2029. Score - 92. (timatkin.com, Chile Special Report 2024)

title: Masi Mazzano Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fresh violets, lilac, wild plums, allspice and wild herbal aromas pour from the glass. The focused palate shows tart cherry preserves, warmed cloves, roasted coffee and dark chocolate that finishes with a crushed chalk minerality. Fine tannins are present but in balance, working with fresh acidity to keep this wine in harmony. Drink now-2045. Editors' Choice. Score - 97. (Jeff Porter, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Fresh violets, lilac, wild plums, allspice and wild herbal aromas pour from the glass. title: Casa Silva Gran Terroir de Los Andes Los Lingues Carmenère 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: 100% Carmenère. The search for Chile's distinguished sites and terroirs continues apace. One sign of this is the way in which the scrutiny of larger zones (like Colchagua) is now falling on sub-regional appellations (like the higher-altitude Los Lingues, with its Andean mountain influences). If this Los Lingues Carmenère from is anything to go by, excitements await. The wine is an opaque purple-black in colour, with exciting, zesty aromas of pounded fruits and freshly cut flowers. In the mouth, it's smooth yet ample in volume, almost seamless and remarkably harmonious for such a young wine. The flavours are fruit-led, with ample soft plum and blueberry charm, yet that floral aromatic refinement persists in the mouth and lends the fruits complexity and grace. Ultra-soft tannins and gentle, almost sweetly fruity acidity (an acidity which barely seems acid) complete the beguiling picture. Best in Show. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: 100% Carmenère. The search for Chile's distinguished sites and terroirs continues apace. title: Trivento Golden Reserve Malbec 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: For this Golden Reserve, Trivento uses grapes primarily from third-party vineyards (80% of the volume), all in Luján de Cuyo - Vistalba, Las Compuertas, Agrelo, and Perdriel. Of the total, 85% was aged in barrels and the remainder, in foudres. And it's a juicy, refreshing, and very fruity version of a Luján malbec. You can taste the black fruit and the spices typical of the zone, which is somewhat warmer than Uco, Cuyo's other major zone. But this wine also has vibrant acidity and firm, sharp tannins. An excellent version of this classic in the Trivento portfolio, first produced for the 2000 vintage. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Cave du Château de Chénas Coeur de Granit 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made from grapes grown in granitic soils and aged in stainless-steel tanks to preserve fruit intensity and freshness, this supple Gamay offers aromas of pomegranate, peony seeds, cardamom, and a hint of bubble gum. The snappy acidity makes it pair well with many meals, from herb-and-lemon roast chicken to a spicy black-bean burrito.[The Concours International du Gamay did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Concours International du Gamay, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine is crafted to be an approachable, fruity, easy-drinking Cabernet with wide appeal. It's sourced from sandy soils in the Wahluke Slope area, where the warmth of the day is offset by cooler evening temperatures, imparting vibrancy and lift to the ripe, concentrated fruit, mocha and herbal notes. Ideal with pork tenderloin or braised short ribs. Drink through 2029.

title: D.V. Catena Historic Red Blend 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Tinto Histórico DV Catena is a blend of 75% Malbec, 18% Bonarda and 7% Petit Verdot from Luján de Cuyo and the Uco Valley and was aged for eight months in new and used barrels. It's garnet red in the glass. The ripe, liqueur-like nose offers sour cherry and plum notes leavened by fresh herbal notes over a pleasant secondary layer from the aging process. Quite smooth with good volume, the flow is juicy yet a little compressed in the mouth. Drinking window: 2022-2033. Score - 92. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Nov. 3, 2022)

title: Courtois La Grange Vinsobres 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Pretty ruby color with purple reflection on the rim, this unoaked blend of grenache and syrah presents with beautiful red plum, strawberry, toasted bread and leather aromas. Lively on the palate with fresh acidity and more savoury character than anticipated, it showcases dry bay leaf and black olives flavours with a fruity note in the backdrop. Pleasant to drink on its own with its polished tannins and well-integrated alcohol, it's got a nice medium-full body to enjoy beside grilled meats on the barbecue or a hearty lentil and mushroom stew. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value! Score - 92. (Louise Boutin, winecurrent.com, Jan. 8, 2024)

title: Peter Lehmann The Barossan Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Many accredit Peter Lehmann with saving the Barossa Valley wine industry in the 1970s. He sourced and blended surplus grapes from dozens of winemaking families, crafting wines that would get small local operations through tough times. A man of the people, his spirit is alive in this Barossan blend, with its flavours of blueberry jam, peppery spice, and flecks of coconut shavings.

title: Planeta Frappato 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Hibiscus tea, freeze-dried strawberry, wild cherries, warm bricks and candied orange peel on the nose meet a subtle earthiness. On the palate, a squeeze of orange and a sprinkle of salt underscore both the sweetness and the astringency of the fruit, while tannins and acid sit back and relax. Score - 92. title: Bussola Vigneto Alto TB Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2011
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2011 Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva TB takes its time opening up in theglass, emerging with rich black cherries offset by sour citrus. Over time, its fruit evolves more toward tart raspberry with holiday spices, brown sugar and incense. The textures are like weighty crushed velvet, slowly draped across the palate, leaving ripe black fruits and notes of chocolate, with sweet violet pastille and hints of roasted almond that last well into the finish. Round tannins linger but don't get in the way of this deeply seductive and perfectly balanced expression. A few years of cellaring should unveil further aromatic depths that will heighten the experience, yet this is already pure pleasure in a glass. Drinking window: 2023-2036. Score - 95. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Feb. 2021)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2011 Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Riserva TB takes its time opening up in theglass, emerging with rich black cherries offset by sour citrus. Over time, its fruit evolves more toward tart raspberry with holiday spices, brown sugar and incense. title: Ornellaia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Ornellaia captures all the magic of this sensational vintage on the Tuscan Coast. Rich, ample and expansive, with tremendous polish, the 2021 is pure class. Dark-toned fruit, mocha, espresso, licorice, plum and dried herbs abound. The tannins are present but also beautifully integrated, as is the French oak. There was a time not too long ago when young wines here needed years in bottle to drink well. That's not at all the case with the 2021. The blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 7% Petit Verdot works so well. New oak was 70%. Drinking window: 2027-2051. Score - 99. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 13, 2024)

title: Vaucher Père & Fils Fleurie 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is an attractive version of Fleurie, one of the top-rated of the Beaujolais crus. The nose is very expressive and aromatic, while the palate is full of dark fruit, with some spicy top notes for good measure. The acidity is assertive, and well aligned with the fruit. This lovely wine is very dry, even verging on astringent, and it calls for food, rather than to be drunk on its own. Drink now to 2029.  Score - 93. (Rod Phillips, April 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: The flagship wine of the beloved Lungarotti family, this has been considered one of central Italy's finest reds since its first vintage in 1964. [Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 99. (lucamaroni.com, June 26, 2023)

title: Thymiopoulos Young Vines Xinomavro 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Wine Society sells bucketloads of this lively Greek red, made by Decanter's Rising Star of 2022, Apostolos Thymiopoulos. And it's obvious why: it's fantastic value for money, and is one of my favourite everyday reds, not only in summer but year round. It's a brilliant introduction to the Xinomavro grape, juicy, approachable and fresh - serve it lightly chilled and enjoy the cranberry, cherry and herbaceous tomato leaf flavours. There's no oak here (it's aged in a mix of stainless steel and concrete), just an uncomplicated, joyful fruit purity. Some whole-bunch in this vintage adds extra juiciness. If you enjoy it, experiment with some of the other Wine Society-listed Thymiopoulos Xinomavros, including the more complex Rapsani Terra Petra and the new Xinomavro rosé. Drinking window: 2023-2025. Score - 91. (Amy Wislocki, decanter.com, Aug. 2, 2023)

title: Creekside Iconoclast Syrah 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Three blocks contribute to Creekside's syrah and for those who have been paying attention the first four letters in this wine's name speak the cool truth. Add a terrific vintage for Bench reds out of Niagara on top of an already established view on what works well and where, well you are seeing the picture laid out bare, base and necessary. Iconoclast is a beacon of varietal excellence from 2020 with its fruit animosity and meaty glare. The co-conspiratorial symmetry and symbiosis make for a grand statement, a structured one at that and what may be the top drop seen. Tasted too. Drink 2023-2027. Tasted October 2022. Score - 92. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Sister's Run Old Testament Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Coonawarra region is unique in viticulture thanks to its abundance of gum trees. The sap and pollen from the trees extends to nearby vineyards and imparts a distinctly floral, camphoraceous character to the wines. Offering flavours of cassis and black licorice accented by aromas of eucalyptus and mint, this lovely red is sure to impress your guests.[The Melbourne International Wine Competition did not include a tasting note.] Score - 94. (Melbourne International Wine Competition, 2023)

title: Tornatore Etna Rosso 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 Etna Rosso is remarkably pretty, leading off with dusty roses and dried strawberries complicated by suggestions of violet and lavender. This flows effortlessly across the palate with floral-laced red fruits enhanced by sour citrus and spice. The 2020 lingers incredibly long yet maintains a lovely inner freshness. The 2020 is exceptionally pure and impossible to resist. Drinking window: 2024-2028. Score - 92. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Sept. 14, 2023)

title: Viña Pedrosa Gran Reserva 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: Only made in the best vintages, such as 2008, 2010 and 2015, the Pedrosa Gran Reserva hails from two parcels - Valtarreña and El Espino - that are both over 60 years' old. Inky, dark and well structured, this is a wine that is built to age for a decade or more. Aged in new French and American oak, it's savoury, dense and just beginning to develop some balsamic undertones to complement the flavours of black fruits and dried herbs. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 96. (timatkin.com, Ribera del Duero 2020/21 Top 100)
