title: Columbia Crest Grand Estates Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Cabernet Sauvignon plus a small percentage of Merlot and Syrah adds up to a big 'bang for the buck' experience. Black-cherry, dark-chocolate and orange aromas are flanked by wee bits of well-worn leather and roasted red bell pepper. The wine has grippy tannins and soft acidity to match up with gobs of blackcap-raspberry and blueberry flavors. Little touches of cedar and mocha powder add interest. Best Buy. Score - 89. (Michael Alberty, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2022)

title: La Nerthe Les Cassagnes Côtes du Rhône-Villages 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Deep plum, cassis and amarena-cherry nose that isn't a jot loud. I love the delicate bitter-chocolate and licorice overtones that add complexity. Rich, mellow and surprisingly elegant, this is a superior Côtes-du-Rhône with beautiful integration of fruit, tannin and body at the long, velvety finish. A classic GSM (Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre) Rhône blend. From organically grown grapes. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, March 21, 2022)

It will deliver big dark fruit, smoke, spice and earth in a ripe, velvety frame.

title: Domaine Gouron Chinon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a very fine example of chinon and from a very good vintage. Made, of course, entirely of cabernet franc, it shows solid and complex aromatics that introduce a palate where classic cabernet franc flavours are well layered and delicious. The acid is perfectly calibrated to the fruit and the tannins are well integrated. It's drinking very well now and will easily hold to the mid/late 2020s. Score - 92. (Rod Phillips, undated)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: This is a very fine example of chinon and from a very good vintage. title: Mullineux Kloof Street 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Almost too good,' mused Chris Mullineux when he poured this wine and I know what hemeans. Combining Syrah, 30% Grenache, 17% Tinta Barocca and 10% Cinsault, it massively over-delivers at its price point, with perfumed 30% whole bunches, bramble, red cherry and white pepper flavours and some granitic grip and freshness. Almost impossible to beat at the price. Drink date: 2024-2029. Best Value Red of the Year. Score - 93. (timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2024)

title: Don David Reserve Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: Unabashedly bold, Don David Reserve Malbec revels in its concentrated fruit and oaky character. Pair with grilled lamb chops.

raw_ec_shortdesc: Baco Noir is grown virtually exclusively in Canada, and Henry of Pelham is home to some of the very best expressions. This wants big meaty meals; think barbecued flank steak, bison burgers or lamb kebabs.

title: Ca' Romé Romano Marengo Cerretta Barolo 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2017 Barolo Cerretta is a dark, mysterious wine. Black cherry, lavender, sage, mint and licorice bring out a darker, more muscular side of Nebbiolo. Firm, driving tannins add to an impression of gravitas and power. Even with all of its tannic clout, the Cerretta is endowed with terrific balance and class. This is impressive. Drinking window: 2025-2037. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 2021)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2017 Barolo Cerretta is a dark, mysterious wine. Black cherry, lavender, sage, mint and licorice bring out a darker, more muscular side of Nebbiolo. Firm, driving tannins add to an impression of gravitas and power. Even with all of its tannic clout, the Cerretta is endowed with terrific balance and class. This is impressive. Drinking window: 2025-2037. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Feb. 2021)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Ghost Pines looks beyond regional boundaries to find the best grapes available throughout California for their wines. title: Seven Falls Cellars Merlot 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Seven Falls Cellars 2020 Merlot is a dry, full-bodied and plummy Merlot with dark cherry, chocolate, vanilla, anise, cinnamon and cedar brush spice with balanced acidity and creamy tannins. Lovely now, try it with an equally elegant and juicy roast of pork. The Merlot grapes for this vintage were sourced from the Wahluke Slope, one [of] the warmest, driest regions in Washington's Columbia Valley. Drink: 2023-2027. Score - 91. (nataliemaclean.com, May 27, 2023)

title: Zuccardi Concreto Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: What a perfumed nose with plenty of violets, iodine, blueberries and mineral. Lots of sappy fruit with fine-grained tannins that tightly wrap the full-bodied palate. Pristine, concentrated and quintessential. A selection of the stoniest soils from Paraje Altamira. 100% whole-bunch fermentation. Needs at least two years to soften the tannins. Drink from 2025. [This has the potential to see the mid-2030s.]  Score - 95. (Zekun Shuai, jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2023)

title: Quadrus Red 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: This blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Sousão comes from vineyards planted in 2005 selected by Tony Amaro of Toronto's Opus Restaurant. The hot, dry 2018 vintage was the warmest in 86 years and required great attention in the vineyards to ensure a balanced maturation. This wine shows dark cherry, plum, clove, and pepper spice. Enjoy it with braised meats or cellar through 2028+.

title: Quercecchio Brunello di Montalcino 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: After the drought- and frost-stricken 2017 vintage, 2018 was a welcome return to form for the region of Montalcino. Vineyards experienced ideal temperatures, bountiful sunshine and little rainfall, making for silky-smooth, fresh wines with complex flavours built for the long haul. This one is drinking beautifully now after an hour in the decanter and has the gusto to survive well into the mid-2030s.

title: Buried Cane Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Buried Cane is found in Richland (part of the tri-cities) and their fruit source is the wide and broad Columbia Valley for middle of the road cabernet sauvignon. A true mix of ripeness and smoky or toasty barrel notes for a truly recognizable, drinkable and easy going varietal wine. Resides in that raspberry-cocoa lane with just a kiss of sweetness (4 g/L of residual sugar) and drier if also more effective tannins than expected. A good vintage for this brand with a solid viticultural name. Drink 2024-2027. Tasted March 2024. Score - 88. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Buried Cane is found in Richland (part of the tri-cities) and their fruit source is the wide and broad Columbia Valley for middle of the road cabernet sauvignon. title: Southbrook Triomphe Organic Merlot 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Ontario's 2019 vintage threw many a curveball at winemakers, including some wild fall weather, but created wines of exceptional freshness. Varieties that ripen in the early-to-mid-season, such as Pinot Noir, Gamay and Merlot, did particularly well. This Merlot offers plum, blackberry, chocolate, smoke and spice, with the crisp acidity of the vintage. Rich, supple and long, it will drink through 2027+.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Ontario's 2019 vintage threw many a curveball at winemakers, including some wild fall weather, but created wines of exceptional freshness. title: Michael David Freakshow Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: The farmland on which this winery's vineyard now sits was originally devoted to vegetables. By the era of Prohibition, it was home to many different fruits including 15 unique wine grape varieties. This juicy, ripe wine shows plum, dark currant, cherry, chocolate, roasted herbs, smoke and earth. It's perfect for filet mignon or barbecued beef ribs. The 2021 vintage was rated Excellent, Highly Recommended, 92/100 by Wine Enthusiast.

title: San Silvestro Patres Barolo 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Delicate scents of rose petals, tar and dried herbs intertwine with hints of cherry and truffle in this captivating Barolo. Drink 2025-2040. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Jeff Porter, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2024)

title: Ramirez de la Piscina Crianza 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2019 Crianza is 100% Tempranillo sourced from San Vicente de la Sonsierra and Ábalos, Rioja Alta. Aged for 14 months in used American and French barrels (50/50), this purple wine showcases aromas of blackberry and blueberry, with hints of vanilla and coconut against an oak backdrop. Dry and juicy, the grippy palate lingers with a chalky texture, presenting a balanced expression of Rioja. Drinking window: 2024-2034. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, April 18, 2024)

title: Gérard Bertrand Heritage An 1886 Les Aspres Grenache/Mourvèdre/Syrah 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Made in the same manner as the Tautavel An 560 bottling but using just 40% Grenache, with the balance split equally between Mourvèdre and Syrah, the 2019 Côtes du Roussillon Villages Les Aspres An 1886 offers up scents of fine leather, licorice and black cherries, without the more floral flourishes of its stablemate. It's medium to full-bodied, supple and streamlined, with an easy flow across the palate and a long, spice-driven finish. This vintage, it's my ever-so-slight preference. Drink date: 2021-2027. Score - 91. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Sept. 23, 2021)

title: Bodega Norton Barrel Select Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 1895, an English engineer, Edmund James Palmer Norton, arrived in Argentina to assist in constructing the railways across the Andes. title: San Pedro 1865 Selected Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: [Limited-edition Year of the Snake bottling.] San Pedro produces no fewer than a million liters of this red, an ocean literally made of cabernet sauvignon from the Alto Jahuel zone, along with 40% Linderos, all in the Maipo Valley. title: Sur de los Andes Reserva Malbec/Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Malbec - Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva is 50% Malbec, 46% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot from Luján de Cuyo and the Uco Valley and was 50% aged for six months in used French and American 225/500-liter barrels and 50% in stainless steel and concrete vats. Garnet red with a purple sheen. The enticing nose delivers notes of plum, ash and green bell pepper. The 2021 is dry with finely-grained tannins. The taut, plush mouthfeel produces a bold, terse palate with a pyrazine-inflected finish. Drinking window: 2023-2031. Score - 91. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, Sept. 7, 2023)

title: Wolf Blass Grey Label Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: If you love those generous, plush, richly flavoured McLaren Vale reds, oozing chocolate and black fruits, then you will go wild over this wine. Best of all, at this price fill the cellar, stunning value. The wine is fermented by way of individual vineyard batches in small open-top fermenters for between five and fifteen days. Maturation was for 17 months in a mix of 73% seasoned and 27% new French and American oak. A vibrant opaque purple, we have aromas of chocolate, cigar boxes, fruitcake and plums. There are black fruits, aniseed and cloves, that are plush and ever-so-generous. Abundant but cashmere-like tannins, gorgeous flavours and very good length with such a seductive and alluring texture. Drink over the next five to eight years, but good luck keeping your hands off it, after you've tried it once. This is undoubtedly the best buy from the Luxury Collection. Drink: 2023-2031. Score - 95. (Ken Gargett, winepilot.com, July 2023)

title: By Farr Farrside Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Farrside vineyard is a northeast-facing slope consisting of limestone topped with black volcanic soil. This sees about 60% new oak for 18 months. Superbly complex and lifted aromatically. Green pea, bramble, savoury spice, game meat and rhubarb, freshened by macerated strawberry. A broody palate nevertheless with lovely lift and glide and a cooling mineral feel. Cherry, earth, and forest floor are wrapped up in tangy acid and fine, persistent tannins to an earthy close. At once elegant and brooding. A brilliant wine. Drinking window: 2026-2031. Score - 95. (Tom Kline, decanter.com, April 27, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Farrside vineyard is a northeast-facing slope consisting of limestone topped with black volcanic soil. This sees about 60% new oak for 18 months. raw_ec_shortdesc: Youthful, lifted aromas of blackberry, mulberry, satsuma plum, sweet spice and cedary oak. The palate is dark, juicy and mouth-filling. title: Rodney Strong Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The hillsides of Alexander Valley are home to this lush but vibrant cabernet that doesn't have the gloss of Napa but rather the umami, garrigue, and deliciousness of Sonoma. Red plums and dark berries, which winemaker Seidenfled describes as dried figs, give this wine a structure that pleases without scaring the drinker. It spends 18 months in French oak barrels (50% new), which you can sense but doesn't dominate while dissipating. Drink or hold through 2028. 2021 was a very dry season with approximately 15% lower yields than previous years, triggering higher concentrations of flavours. Impressive for the price. Score - 91. (Anthony Gismondi, gismondionwine.com, Aug. 16, 2024)

raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine was fermented in small vats and then spent nine months in oak. It shows savoury herbs, earth, tangy mixed berry and pepper atop subtle oak spice tones. title: Carpineto Chianti Classico 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: A jeweled ruby color, the 2021 Chianti Classico is ripe and has a great nose of fresh wild herbs, pure raspberry, graphite, and fresh violets. Medium-bodied, its more cedar tones come through on the palate, with ripe, very well-integrated tannins, clean lift, and a hint of its toasted incense on the finish. A very well-balanced wine from Carpineto, it's showing beautifully now but will certainly improve in another 6 months. Drink date: 2024-2034. Score - 90. (Audrey Frick, jebdunnuck.com, Jan. 25, 2024)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A jeweled ruby color, the 2021 Chianti Classico is ripe and has a great nose of fresh wild herbs, pure raspberry, graphite, and fresh violets. title: Tenuta di Trinoro 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The flagship wine from Tenuta di Trinoro is this gorgeous blend of 92% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot. The 2020 Tenuta di Trinoro follows on the heels of the 2019 vintage that earned a perfect 100-point score. The 2020 vintage is more open-knit for sure, but it offers a very special view onto Cabernet Franc in particular. The plush black cherry softness of the Merlot is aligned magically with the dark intensity and tannic power of the Cabernet Franc. The fruit ripeness is impeccable and there are no green tones, nor are there any overripe nuances. Everything comes together with balance. For the first time, this wine is being released with an extra year of bottle age. Drink date: 2024-2048. Score - 97. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, May 31, 2023)

title: Versado Malbec 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Versado estate malbec from Canadians Peter Gamble and Ann Sperling happens with a local team, that being Esteban (administrator for La Productiva); Oscar and Soledad (Caseros or caretakers) at Villa Viamonte. This may just be the most concentrated and yet graceful of all their 'entry-level' malbecs to date. There is a whole lot of barrel involved but my how smooth, silken and the whole package turns out to be. Remarkably perfumed in spite of all that wood, acids high, spirited and fine, tannins at peak performance. Needs time to unwind, unravel and fully integrate. I would personally not touch this wine for three years at least. Drink 2024-2029. Tasted November 2021. Score - 91. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Savory and complex with dried orange peel, cedar and plenty of sweet spices, walnuts, caramel, dried mushrooms and pine needles. title: Masi Costasera Riserva Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: An Amarone that nudges Port, such is the density and liqueur-like notes of cocoa nibs, mocha, root spices and dried cherries. The tannins restrain the flavors into a sense of composure on one hand, while drying out the finish on the other. Very drying. Presumably, this simply needs time, or at least it is best to hope so. Drinkable now, but best from 2030 [through late 2030s]. Score - 93. (Ned Goodwin, MW, jamessuckling.com, May 3, 2024)

title: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: 'Great expectations, here we go again,' said in the most positive of respects voice and while the Cinzano family may not think in hyperbole, for this vintage they most surely appreciate an opportunity to create what matters from the gifts of nature. Many producers will go low and some high but Col d'Orcia stays the estate heritage course to make sure both early generosity and more importantly aging structure is the long term plan. You feel the up front wholesomeness and then the length because the framework is everything and projections essential to understanding and appreciating this modal world. Fine wine so worthy of praises because we know it will impress in 2039. How could we doubt such a prognosis? Drink 2025-2039. Tasted November 2023. Score - 95. (Michael Godel, winealign.com)

title: Paul Jaboulet Aîné La Chapelle Hermitage 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The beautifully proportioned 2018 Hermitage La Chapelle comes across as a complex, complete version of this renowned bottling, with no rough edges - just moderate spice, cassis, red berries and cedar on the nose. It's medium to full-bodied, silky and fine, brimming with harmony and elegance on the palate, while the finish is long, echoing with cassis, charcoal and crushed stone. The tannins firm up a bit on the finish, so I suspect this will close down soon, then blossom sometime after 2025. Drink date: 2025-2040. Score - 98+. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 13, 2021)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The beautifully proportioned 2018 Hermitage La Chapelle comes across as a complex, complete version of this renowned bottling, with no rough edges - just moderate spice, cassis, red berries and cedar on the nose. It's medium to full-bodied, silky and fine, brimming with harmony and elegance on the palate, while the finish is long, echoing with cassis, charcoal and crushed stone. The tannins firm up a bit on the finish, so I suspect this will close down soon, then blossom sometime after 2025. Drink date: 2025-2040. Score - 98+. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 13, 2021)

title: Inglenook Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Tobacco, dark chocolate and blackcurrants on the nose, something quite meaty and savoury about the nose too. Succulent and juicy, really quite lightly framed despite the concentration, tannins are well integrated and support the crisp blueberry and black cherry fruit. Supple with a nice energy and bounce, doesn't feel too hot or too much, balanced and harmonious. An enjoyably cool finish too - overall impressive construction and length. Super lively, juicy and delineated. Tobacco, cedar and liquorice mark the finish suggesting this needs time to age and soften but this has excellent potential and should age gracefully. Ageing 20 months in French oak, 50% new. Winemaker Philippe Bascaules. Drinking window: 2026-2040. Score - 96. (Georgina Hindle, decanter.com, July 31, 2023)

title: Jasper Hill Georgia's Paddock Shiraz 2015
raw_ec_shortdesc: A big, rich wine, the 2015 Georgia's Paddock Shiraz offers deep, earthy notes of black olive and espresso that complement the blackberry and plum fruit. There's a hint of menthol that helps lift the wine and avoid any undue sense of heaviness - a notable accomplishment in a wine that's labeled at 15% alcohol. Full-bodied and velvety in texture, complex and long, with two decades of aging potential, there's simply nothing to criticize here. Drink date: 2020-2035. Score - 96. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, June 29, 2018)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A big, rich wine, the 2015 Georgia's Paddock Shiraz offers deep, earthy notes of black olive and espresso that complement the blackberry and plum fruit. title: Masi Campofiorin IGT
raw_ec_shortdesc: Masi created Campofiorin in 1964, utilizing the rich residual pomace leftover from Amarone production to add depth to their Valpolicella.  What they created is now called Ripasso, one of the most famous Italian wines. The wine is dry and medium-bodied with fig, cherry and spice flavours. Pair with lamb and polenta.

title: San Felice Chianti Classico
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine includes some Pugnitello: an ancient Tuscan grape that was nearly extinct when San Felice began working with it in the late 1980s. This Chianti Classico is smooth, expressive, pure and characterful, with black cherry, blackcurrant, earth, tobacco, and a precise minerality. Harmonious and long, it's ideal for charcuterie, roast turkey or grilled beef.

title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is a little reticent than some of the wines presented in this vintage on the nose, but with time it reveals the scents of black pepper, blackcurrant and vanilla cream. The palate shows a very complete substance, fresh and convincing, quite seamless in style, with some ripe grip underneath it. An impressive composition overall, very elegant and correct, albeit with a flourish of tannins in the finish. A very promising start, and a long, lingering, tannin-infused finish. Very good, with fine cellaring potential.  [This will hold into the early 2030s.] Score - 94. (Chris Kissack, thewinedoctor.com, Sept. 2018)

title: La Mascota Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from alluvial and clay-loam soils at around 1,000 metres above sea level, this Cab is fermented with indigenous yeasts and aged for 18 months in French oak. A great wine with lamb or steak, this superb value will evolve for 5-8 years from vintage, making it a great cellar starter.

title: Château Pipeau Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
raw_ec_shortdesc: Lauded by the international wine press, this is a decadent and surprisingly affordable Grand Cru from Saint-Émilion, one of Bordeaux's crown jewels. Chocolate, smoky, prune and long with a spicy finish. Try with slow-cooked roast beef or lamb shanks. A great cellar-starter.

title: Smoking Loon Old Vine Zinfandel
raw_ec_shortdesc: Zinfandel's history in California dates to the gold rush of the 1850s. Some of the earliest plantings of Zinfandel still exist today (the eponymous 'Old Vines'). This Zinfandel shows smoky oak, vanilla, plum, and fig notes with a soft, silky mouth feel.  The Smoking Loon Zinfandel is an ideal match for barbecued ribs.

title: Tawse Growers Blend Cabernet Franc 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous, ripe year for Niagara growers, this 2020 cabernet franc puts the vintage, and talented winemaking, on full display in a style that's somewhere between the Loire and Bordeaux. Absent are the variety's leafy-herbal pyrazines, traded in for riper red and black fruit, while wood is a minor contribution to the overall profile. Length and depth are very good, and in the final summary, this is a sharp value in one of Ontario's strongest varietal categories. Drink now-2028 or so. Tasted July 2023. Score - 91. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A generous, ripe year for Niagara growers, this 2020 cabernet franc puts the vintage, and talented winemaking, on full display in a style that's somewhere between the Loire and Bordeaux. Absent are the variety's leafy-herbal pyrazines, traded in for riper red and black fruit, while wood is a minor contribution to the overall profile. Length and depth are very good, and in the final summary, this is a sharp value in one of Ontario's strongest varietal categories. Drink now-2028 or so. Tasted July 2023. Score - 91. title: Legón Premium 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Deep garnet in the glass, this wine proffers a bouquet of black cherry, mocha and clove. It is slightly spicy, with deep-set tannins and notes of anisette and eucalyptus playing host to cassis, purple plum, violet and orange zest flavors. Closing notes bring milk chocolate and more violet. Score - 94. (Mike DeSimone, Wine Enthusiast, July 1, 2023)

title: Borsao Tres Picos Garnacha
raw_ec_shortdesc: Just south of Rioja and inland from the cooling Ebro River, the heat-soaked little Campo de Borja region is home to robust, ripe wines such as this modern-styled take. title: Fabre Montmayou Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Perdriel is the source of this Cabernet Sauvignon, a stony terroir close to the Mendoza river that's widely recognised as one of the best places to grow the grape in Mendoza. Minty and refreshing, this has nuanced oak, bramble and blackcurrant pastille flavours and sculpted tannins. Drink date: 2024-2029. Score - 91. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Argentina Special Report 2023)

title: Viña Real Gran Reserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: The extremely affordable 2016 Viña Real Gran Reserva Especial recovers the 'Especial' mention from the old Reserva Especial vintages from a very good year. It's a classical Rioja Alavesa blend of 95% Tempranillo with 5% Graciano from their own vineyards. It's open and expressive, with notes of berries, fresh blood and iron, orange peel and sweet spices with the oak still present and in need of some more time in bottle. The palate is medium-bodied and feels lean and serious, with abundant chalky tannins. This should be a classical vintage of this wine in the making. It matured in barrel for two years and no less than three in bottle. It was bottled in March 2019. Drink date: 2023-2034. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, July 14, 2022)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The extremely affordable 2016 Viña Real Gran Reserva Especial recovers the 'Especial' mention from the old Reserva Especial vintages from a very good year. It's open and expressive, with notes of berries, fresh blood and iron, orange peel and sweet spices with the oak still present and in need of some more time in bottle. title: San Alejandro Evodia 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Evodia comes from a cold year with snow, frost and some extreme temperatures (-18 degrees Celsius!) but an average rest of the season, some hail in July(!) and quite a lot of rain in early October, so not a year without challenges. They estimate a 25% decrease in yields, but the grapes picked before the rain delivered fresh wines with good aging potential. This finished at 14.6% alcohol and with good freshness and acidity. It fermented with some 15% full clusters in concrete, and 60% of the volume remained in concrete while the rest was equal parts in used 225-liter barrels and large oak vats for five months. It was a very challenging year, but the result feels great, a cooler and fresher vintage than 2020 and 2022. It's a fragrant Garnacha, a fruit-driven and juicy effort with super fine tannins and a balanced mouthfeel. Volume has gone down and price has gone up a bit, but the quality has also grown and it's still a great bargain. Drink date: 2023-2027. Score - 91+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, May 31, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The 2021 Evodia comes from a cold year with snow, frost and some extreme temperatures (-18 degrees Celsius!) but an average rest of the season, some hail in July(!) and quite a lot of rain in early October, so not a year without challenges. They estimate a 25% decrease in yields, but the grapes picked before the rain delivered fresh wines with good aging potential. This finished at 14.6% alcohol and with good freshness and acidity. It fermented with some 15% full clusters in concrete, and 60% of the volume remained in concrete while the rest was equal parts in used 225-liter barrels and large oak vats for five months. It was a very challenging year, but the result feels great, a cooler and fresher vintage than 2020 and 2022. It's a fragrant Garnacha, a fruit-driven and juicy effort with super fine tannins and a balanced mouthfeel. Volume has gone down and price has gone up a bit, but the quality has also grown and it's still a great bargain. Drink date: 2023-2027. Score - 91+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, May 31, 2023)

title: Henry of Pelham Baco Noir VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: Baco noir's wild berry and smoky notes are deftly handled at Henry of Pelham, where this grape has become a recognized specialty. Deep ruby red colour with purple hints; smoky, prune aromas with spice, floral and chocolate notes. Extra dry and medium-bodied with pronounced chokeberry flavours lingering on a smoky finish.

title: La Vieille Ferme Cotes Du Ventoux AOC
raw_ec_shortdesc: This unpretentious red from the renowned Perrin Family opens with attractive notes of red fruit, such as blackcurrants and blueberries, with touches of leather and violet. raw_ec_shortdesc: 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot, and 1% Cabernet Franc aged 16 months in 50% new French oak. Both estate and purchased grapes. raw_ec_shortdesc: Saturated magenta. Deeply pitched dark berry and cherry liqueur scents, plus a hint of licorice and a touch of olive paste. title: Tignanello 2008
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2008 Tignanello is unquestionably one of the wines of the vintage. The 2008 isn't a huge or obvious Tignanello, rather it is a wine that impresses for its sublime elegance and precision. Understated layers of fruit caress the palate like cashmere in this impeccable, soft wine. There is not a hard edge to be found. Black cherries, tobacco, smoke and licorice are some of the notes that come through on the finish. The flavor profile is decidedly on the dark side, but the wine's structure is medium in body and intensity. In 2008 the Tignanello has more energy, focus and length than the Solaia. It is a fabulous achievement! The 2008 Tignanello is 80% Sangiovese aged in 300-liter French oak barrels (1/3rd new), 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc, both aged in 100% new 225-liter French oak barriques. Drinking window: 2014-2024. Score - 94. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Aug. 2011)

title: Girard Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Well-built and deep in flavor, this full-bodied wine is a great value for a Napa Cab. Blended with 5% each of Petit Verdot and Malbec, plus 2% each of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, it shows a calm strength and emerging complexity. The wine blankets deep, dark violet and blackcurrant flavors in fine-grained tannins that could use time to soften a bit. Best from 2026-2036. Editors' Choice. Score - 93. (Jim Gordon, Wine Enthusiast, Sept. 1, 2023)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Medium crimson. Fresh red cherry, strawberry, red plum aromas with cola/chinotto notes. Pure, crisp and supple with attractive red cherry, strawberry pastille, hint roasted walnut flavours, fine loose-knit slinky tannins, some mid-palate viscosity and long fresh acidity. title: Sister's Run Calvary Hill Shiraz 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Dense and dark in the glass. Aromas of spice, stewed plums, blackberry, briar and menthol. Big and fleshy on the palate, plum, mulberry, dark and juicy. title: Villa Wolf Pinot Noir 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: German Pinot Noir (a.k.a. Spätburgunder) is increasingly being seen as an appealing stepping stone between the cerebral elegance of Burgundy and the boisterous fruit of New Zealand, and much of that reputation is based on the quality of wines coming from Pfalz. This one is ripe and spicy, with an elegantly achieved underlying smokiness. Try it with smoked salmon.

title: La Massa Giorgio Primo 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2018 Giorgio Primo represents a new level of finesse at La Massa. Powerful and dense in the glass, with tremendous structure, Giorgio Primo is a terrific example of how compelling international varieties are in Panzano's Conca d'Oro district. Crème de cassis, spice, new leather, chocolate and sweet spice build into the textured, palate-staining finish. Drinking window: 2025-2038. Score - 97. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Sept. 2021)

title: The Prisoner Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Consistently bold, The Prisoner cabernet sauvignon is enhanced with small amounts of merlot, syrah, malbec, petite sirah, and charbono grapes which have been aged for 15 months in both old and new French and American barrels. Blousy but not sweet with very good concentration and nice bit of graphite and bitterness to lend dimension to the palate. A reasonably balanced vintage for this wine. Chill slightly to quell the heat. Best 2025-2030. Tasted July 2024. Score - 90. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)

title: Eastdell Gamay Noir 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Gamay Noir has become Niagara's best-kept secret. It's often overshadowed by its Burgundian counterpart, Pinot Noir. But this wine, with its crunchy red fruit flavours and crisp acidity, makes a compelling bid for the spotlight. Lightly chill this flexible wine and it will be perfect for all occasions. Pour alongside grilled tuna steaks and an arugula salad.

title: Domaine Mucyn Aquilon Cornas 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Profoundly ripe, spicy cassis on the nose and palate are accentuated by bold strikes of licorice, violet and bramble in this rich, complex Syrah. Moderately full in body, it's luscious but freshly balanced, held upright by a crisp acidic backbone and firm, gripping tannins. Delightful already, it will improve through 2035. Score - 95. title: Château Breillan 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Château Breillan is a specialized 'teaching estate' for the Blanquefort viticulture and oenology school. This wine is Merlot and Cabernet Franc sourced from gravel and calcareous clay soils. It's broad and concentrated, with nicely outlined blackcurrant, dark fruit and oak spice and an attractive, easy-to-enjoy character. A real value at this price, it will be great with a winter stew.

It's broad and concentrated, with nicely outlined blackcurrant, dark fruit and oak spice and an attractive, easy-to-enjoy character. A real value at this price, it will be great with a winter stew.

title: Piekenierskloof Six Hats Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: This 100% shiraz from a fairtrade South-African winery is simply spectacular, especially at this friendly price. It's generous on the nose with ripe black plum, mixed berry compote, freshly grated cinnamon and a lovely floral note in the background. There's a cooling freshness on the palate that showcases the dark cherry and plum flavours with a hint of zesty orange beautifully. Tannins are fine and polished and the finish is fruit forward yet dry and slightly peppery. This is a great partner to lamb burgers or rich ratatouille. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value! Score - 92. (Louise Boutin, winecurrent.com, Sept. 11, 2023)

title: Two Sisters Eleventh Post 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: An assemblage of merlot, cabernet sauvignon and cabernet franc, vinified separately and then aged a substantial 30 months in French oak before being blended. Juicy and lush with a voluminous tannic mouthfeel, fresh red fruit, gentle oak spice and tertiary notes of iron, dried leaf and leather. Not too heavy, nicely balanced and with very good concentration and length. Best now to 2025. Tasted November 2022. Score - 91. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)

title: Dough Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Fermented in stainless steel and then aged in a combination of French and American oak, this wine offers superb freshness, drive and depth. There's plenty of Cabernet character, with cassis, ripe black cherry and plum notes atop oak, tobacco and coffee. Pair with grilled steak, mushroom burgers, or a tri-tip sandwich. Dough provides two annual needs-based scholarships to students of George Brown's hospitality and culinary arts programs.

title: J. Lohr Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Cabernet Sauvignon Hilltop lifts from the glass with a peppery freshness, mixing hints of sage with chalk dust and blackberries. It's soothingly round and supple with ripe red and black fruits underscored by saline minerals as grippy tannins mount toward the close. This finishes structured with medium length, leaving the palate refreshed while maintaining youthful poise. Drinking window: 2025-2030. Score - 91. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, July 25, 2024)

title: Alandes Paradoux VII Edition Red Blend
raw_ec_shortdesc: Alandes ('along the Andes') seeks to offer Karim Mussi's view of the mountain wines that arise from the foot of the mountains in the Uco Valley. In this blend, there's merlot, cabernet franc, petit verdot, and cabernet sauvignon from three places in Uco: La Consulta, Los Chacayes, and Gualtallary. They were fermented separately in concrete vats and then aged in barrels for 12 months. This is a dense wine full of aromatic nuances where lots of black fruits, spices, and herbal tones converge in a powerful body with pronounced acidity, although with very fine, well-shaped tannins. One to make room for in the cellar and to keep for many years. Score - 95. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2022)

raw_ec_shortdesc: A precise and polished red with cherry, plum, slate, iron, and powdered earth. It's medium- to full-bodied with sublime tannins that are beautifully integrated into the wine. Drink or hold. Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, Oct. 9, 2023)

title: Meiomi Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 vintage in California was another drought-impacted growing season and the conditions resulted in smaller berries, which translates to wines of greater concentration and bolder fruit flavours. This Cabernet from Meiomi has the ripeness and power of the vintage, with sumptuous cassis, blackberry, toasty vanilla, earth, spice, and a lifted minty herbal note. Great for barbecued meats with spicy rubs.

title: Il Drago e le 8 Colombe 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: In the bottle with the red label, the organic Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2019 Il Drago e le 8 Colombe is a blend of 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 20% Sagrantino. raw_ec_shortdesc: What a great bargain for [under] $16. title: Quinta do Vallado Sousão 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2020 Sousão was aged for 16 months in 15% new French barriques and comes in at 14.3% alcohol. Often my sentimental favorite of their reds, this typically shows off the good acidity, red fruits and velvety texture. As the oak impact has declined (in the distant past it could be as high as 80% new), it shows the red fruits better and has lost that creamy texture it once had. Refined, persistent and flavorful, this is very fine again, if not quite as impressive as last year's. It's hard not to admire its finesse and flavor, though, a great combination. Drink date: 2022-2040. Score - 93. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, July 29, 2022)

title: The Stump Jump Grenache Shiraz Mourvèdre
raw_ec_shortdesc: Legend suggests that Richard Bowyer Smith, who was a South Australian blacksmith and the inventor of the stump-jump plough (which allows ploughs to jump tree roots in difficult terrain), had poor eyesight, hence the optometrist chart on the label. This wine has a supple mouthfeel, with raspberry, plum, dark cherry, earth and savoury herbs. It will see its way clearly to drinking through 2025+.

title: Lapis Luna Zinfandel 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This is more expensive than the Chosen by Majestic Zinfandel, but worth the extra spend. Made by Nicole Walsh, former winemaker at Bonny Doon, entirely from Mendocino fruit, this has 20% Sangiovese in the blend, and has spent 10 months in French and American oak (10% new). As you'd expect from Zinfandel, there's a fair whack of alcohol here and it's rich and round with sweet spice and redcurrant and black berry fruit flavours. It's in balance though, and a good choice if you're in the mood for an easy-drinking robust red, perfect for cold winter nights. Drinking window: 2023-2025. Score - 89. (Amy Wislocki, decanter.com, Oct. 11, 2023)

title: Rtvelisi Mukuzani Dry Red 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: This wine comes from Kakheti, which is Georgia's most important wine region in terms of total production, quality and historical significance. title: Unshackled Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Prisoner's Unshackled is a blend of cabernet sauvignon, malbec, petite sirah, syrah and merlot, with a youthful, juicy disposition despite an abv of 14.5% . One of the most sippable labels in the portfolio, devoid of highly confected oak spice and features supple tannins and a modicum of freshness. Very good concentration and length. Tasted April 2024. Score - 89. (Sara d'Amato, winealign.com)

title: Torre Zambra Madia Montepulciano d'Abruzzo 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: A flinty lift with crushed stones, graphite and new leather on top of the black cherries and a hint of mussels. Juicy, medium-bodied palate, delivering crunchy red berries. A fresh and drinkable expression of Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, rounded by fine, gritty tannins. From organically grown grapes. Vegan. Drink now [or hold until 2028]. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 8, 2022)

title: Bachelder Les Villages Gamay Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The Villages Gamay is a blend of east and west vineyards including lots from Wismer-Foxcroft, Bai Xu, Bator, Willms and now Wiley, the new terroir in the family on the Short Hills Bench. 'It blends the juicy stuff from NOTL with more structure from the Bench,' said Bachelder. It has a lovely floral note on the nose with a melange of juicy red berries, plums, and integrated spice notes. It's mouth-filling and fruit-laden with smooth tannins, subtle meatiness, black raspberries, dark cherries, anise, spice, and a tangy, bright finish. It's drinking fine now but can cellar a few years. [Drink until 2026.] Score - 91. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, May 1, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: The Villages Gamay is a blend of east and west vineyards including lots from Wismer-Foxcroft, Bai Xu, Bator, Willms and now Wiley, the new terroir in the family on the Short Hills Bench. title: Bertani Catullo Valpolicella Ripasso Classico Superiore 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: An atypically light colour for Ripasso, aged in large format French wood following fermentation on pomace of Amarone Classico for one month. This is excellent. There is little to bring awareness to dried fruit characteristics, such is the purity and transparency. A wine of verve, fecund strawberry flavors, a lilt of bergamot and deft levels of concentration. Yet so light on its feet as it pirouettes through the mouth with a mineral twirl and a saline spurt across the long finish. An easy substitute for a quality Burgundy. Drink or hold. Score - 95. (Ned Goodwin, MW, jamessuckling.com, May 9, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: An atypically light colour for Ripasso, aged in large format French wood following fermentation on pomace of Amarone Classico for one month. This is excellent. title: Family Tree 'The Bootlegger' Baco Noir VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: Baco noir is a signature grape in Ontario, and a Speck Brothers specialty. During prohibition, planes landed at the estate to collect loads of locally made whisky and wine. This rich baco embodies the spirit of those times. Smoke, dark fruit and black olive flavours complement roast turkey, glazed ham or savoury stuffing.

title: Kellerei Bozen Lagrein 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Deeply coloured and very fruity on the nose, with appealing black cherry and plummy notes leading, the Bolzano cooperative delivers another solid value here from this native red variety. It's soft and low in tannins per the textbook profile, while acids are comfortably ripe. I like the plump, juicy fruit on the palate, ripe but still fresh, and the lingering finish. Nicely done. Chill lightly and ready to go or hold short term. Tasted June 2024. Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: Cono Sur Pinot Noir Organic
raw_ec_shortdesc: Cono Sur was the first Chilean winery to export pinot noir. Made from organically grown grapes sourced in the Colchagua, San Antonio and Bio-Bio valleys. This balanced and juicy pinot is brimming with floral, underbrush, fig, red fruit and citrus aromas. A great value and the perfect pour for seared tuna or char siu pork.

title: La Ferme du Mont Le Ponnant Côtes du Rhône-Villages 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 2000, Stéphane Vedeau left his career as a football player in France to pursue a more humble, quiet vocation. He's now a superstar winemaker. title: Pascual Toso Limited Edition Malbec
raw_ec_shortdesc: Sourced from Pascual Toso's Estate vineyards in Mendoza, the Limited Edition Malbec is a clean, fruit-forward red with an enticing spicy oak character. title: La Posta Pizzella Family Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A ripe, spicy malbec here full of fresh blackberries, blueberries, some sweet dark spices, black wood and dark chocolate. Crunchy, fresh and juicy on the medium- to full-bodied palate with firm, supportive and small-grained tannins. Plenty of oak spices in the energetic finish. Give it one more year to let the sweet oak spices integrate. Drink from 2024 [through 2028]. Score - 92. (Zekun Shuai, jamessuckling.com, March 27, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A ripe, spicy malbec here full of fresh blackberries, blueberries, some sweet dark spices, black wood and dark chocolate. title: Tedeschi Ansari Amarone della Valpolicella 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2019 Amarone della Valpolicella Ansari takes its time in the glass, initially darkly floral with an herbal tinge. Coaxing brings about an attractive blend of wild berries, violets and crushed stone. Silky and refined, this impresses with its perfect balance of ripe red and blue fruits offset by salty minerals and savory spice. Brisk acidity maintains a wonderfully fresh persona as the 2019 tapers off structured and long. Grippy tannins linger, and the mouth is left watering for more. Drinking window: 2026-2040. Score - 95. (Eric Guido, vinous.com, Feb. 29, 2024)

title: Monasterio de las Viñas Reserva 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Always a killer value, Monasterio's 2019 Reserva, a blend of garnacha, tempranillo, cariñena and cabernet sauvignon, delivers marvellous complexity in the price category, a savoury, sultry, herbal-spicy, dark-fruited red with impeccable balance and very good length, not to mention genuine substance and depth. Remarkable how this company can do this year in and out at the price. Drink or hold until the end of the decade. Tasted July 2024. Score - 90. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: Rombauer Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: A wonderfully classic expression of Napa Cabernet from Rombauer in 2021, leading with blackberry, cherry, liquorice, graphite, and cedarwood. Medium-bodied with pure blackberry fruit, baking spices, creme de cassis, and red currants with a long lingering finish. 88% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Petit Verdot, 4% Cab Franc aged 16 months in French oak (75% new). Koerner Rombauer moved to Napa Valley in 1972. He had no intentions of getting into the winery business and became a partner in Conn Creek Winery in 1976, but had his garage bonded as a winery. Officially bitten by the wine bug, Kerner sold his interests in Conn Creek in 1980, made the first Rombauer wines at Shafer, and stored them in his bonded winery garage. A little side note: Koerner's great aunt Irma Rombauer wrote 'The Joy of Cooking'. Drinking window: 2024-2032. Score - 93. (Jonathan Cristaldi, decanter.com, Dec. 14, 2023)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A wonderfully classic expression of Napa Cabernet from Rombauer in 2021, leading with blackberry, cherry, liquorice, graphite, and cedarwood. Medium-bodied with pure blackberry fruit, baking spices, creme de cassis, and red currants with a long lingering finish. 88% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Petit Verdot, 4% Cab Franc aged 16 months in French oak (75% new). Koerner Rombauer moved to Napa Valley in 1972. He had no intentions of getting into the winery business and became a partner in Conn Creek Winery in 1976, but had his garage bonded as a winery. Officially bitten by the wine bug, Kerner sold his interests in Conn Creek in 1980, made the first Rombauer wines at Shafer, and stored them in his bonded winery garage. title: Castello Romitorio Filo di Seta Brunello di Montalcino 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: Resplendent with a thousand different colours this regal glass of Brunello alternates notes of lemon, face powder, sandalwood, white pepper, linden, rose petals, pink grapefruit and guaranà. In the background the notes of green tea leaves and peppermint give a notable freshness to the matrix. Medium bodied, perfectly mature tannins of a silky character and a very fine finale which exalts from the centre palate onwards to the dynamic, smooth closure. Better from 2024. [Will cellar into the 2040s.] Score - 97. (Raffaele Vecchione, winescritic.com, Oct. 19, 2022)

title: Zuccardi Serie A Malbec 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The varietal Serie A range includes wines from the 'Argentinean' varieties, and the star of this range is, of course, the 2022 Serie A Malbec. Here they search for typicity from Valle de Uco, with freshness and flowers, red rather than black fruit, nice tannic structure and purity; they are not looking for complexity or limestone but varietal character, at which this excels. This has juiciness and structure and is fine-boned. It is very different from the Bonarda in this range. Drink date: 2023-2026. Score - 92. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Nov. 30, 2022)

title: Col d'Orcia Poggio al Vento Riserva Brunello di Montalcino (Magnum) 2004
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2004 Brunello di Montalcino Riserva Poggio al Vento is developing beautifully. This is a decidedly feminine, graceful style of Poggio al Vento. The wine literally floats on the palate with gracious layers of fruit. Silky tannins support sweet red berries, flowers and spices on the mouthwatering finish. The 2004 is flat-out beautiful. This was a relatively generous harvest, and that comes through in the wine's medium-bodied structure.Drinking window: 2014-2044. Score - 95+. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, May 2012)

title: Domaine Autrand Vinsobres 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: The tank-matured 2022 Vinsobres is a blend of 60% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre. It looks like an overachiever at this stage, with bold cherries and raspberries on the nose, even a hint of stone fruit. Full-bodied, round and expansive, with a creamy-textured mid-palate, it moves seamlessly into a long, concentrated and tannic finish. Drink date: 2025-2035. Score - 93. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, May 16, 2024)

title: J. Lohr Pure Paso Proprietary Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: This relatively recent proprietary red-blend creation continues to impress each vintage, showcasing Paso power with deft balance in pleasing ways. Aromas of blackberry jam, violet extract and root-beer floats proceed from the nose into a comforting palate of strawberry, cola and peppery spices. Firm, lingering tannins lead through the caramel-laced finish. Editors' Choice. Score - 93. (Matt Kettman, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 1, 2023)

title: Casa di Luigi Pinot Noir KPM
raw_ec_shortdesc: Chile's Central Valley region runs for 400 kilometres from the Maipo Valley in the north to the Maule Valley. It's often mistaken for the geological Central Valley, which runs north-south for more than 1,000 kilometres between the Coastal Range and the Chilean Andes. Cool areas in river valleys, coastal sites, and the Andean foothills allow for Pinot Noir with notable freshness, dark fruit and spice.

title: Sea Sun Pinot Noir 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: Produced by Charlie Wagner, Sea Sun 2021 Pinot Noir is crafted from grapes sourced from California's cool-climate coastal vineyards. The Wagners come from a long line of Napa Valley wine grape growers and winemakers dating back to the 1850s. They're also the family who produce the coveted Caymus wines. Sea Sun is dry, medium-plus-bodied and creamy on the palate with dark berry, dark cherry, loamy earth, baking and pepper spice flavours with a kiss of vanilla and vibrant acidity on the palate. Just lovely with a roast duck or turkey dinner. Drink: 2024-2028. Score - 90. (nataliemaclean.com, May 11, 2024)

raw_ec_shortdesc: Monte Creek won the 2021 Thompson Okanagan Tourism Association's Sustainable Project of the Year for their campaign to protect endangered badgers. title: Adamo Estate Parke Vineyard Grower's Series Pinot Noir 2017
raw_ec_shortdesc: Adamo is an ambitious project in the Hockley Valley (actually on a hilltop) near Orangeville, and as their own vines mature winemaker Shauna White is sourcing from prime sites in Niagara, like the Parke Vineyard on Twenty Mile Bench. This pours pale garnet. The nose is nicely lifted and complex with wood smoke curling around classic sour cherry, cinnamon and vanillin. It's light to mid-weight, very smooth with very refined tannin. There is a tart and sour streak with lurking volatility but it squeaks under my normally low bar, and flavour intensity and length are excellent. Well priced for premium Niagara pinot. Drink now to 2025. Score - 91. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Adamo is an ambitious project in the Hockley Valley (actually on a hilltop) near Orangeville, and as their own vines mature winemaker Shauna White is sourcing from prime sites in Niagara, like the Parke Vineyard on Twenty Mile Bench. raw_ec_shortdesc: The little-known Durif grape (a.k.a. Petite Sirah) has found a comfortable home in the Suisun Valley just southeast of Napa. title: Kir-Yianni Cuvée Villages Xinomavro 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: A spicy grape native to Greece, Xinomavro (ksee-NOH-mah-vroh) is well-known for its bold, tangy character, which should come as no surprise since its name loosely translates to 'black acid.' With aromas of black olive, star anise, leather and espresso, this hearty red will make a lovely accompaniment to lamb gyros.

title: Cellier des Dauphins Réserve Côtes du Rhône 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous Cotes du Rhone with stacks of blackberry and red berry fruit plus a touch of licorice. The ample soft tannins on the full-bodied palate give this an attractively velvety mouthfeel, then comes a blast of blueberry at the generous, but moderately dry finish. A cuvee of 60% grenache and 40% syrah. Drink now [or hold until 2028]. Score - 90. (Stuart Pigott, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 1, 2024)

title: Escudo Rojo Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: All from vineyards in the Buin area, near Alto Maipo, on the alluvial terraces of the southern bank of the Maipo River and beside the BPR winery in the Maipo Valley. These are 20-year-old vines that have produced this delicious juice of red fruits with spicy notes and a bit of herbs. The palate has very fine, firm tannins and lively acidity. The wine flows through the mouth. A surprising value for money here because of how delicious it is although especially because it offers a sense of place. And at this price, that's not common. [Drink through 2027+.] Score - 92. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2024)

title: Koncho Kindzmarauli 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Kindzmarauli is highly regarded as one of the top wines of Georgia; a country with an astounding 8,000-year wine history. It's a late-harvest wine made with the local grape Saperavi (whose name means 'paint' or 'dye' in reference to the deep colour of the wines it produces) and matured for two years before release. Serve chilled with desserts, fruit, or blue cheeses.

title: Castelforte Valpolicella Ripasso 2020
raw_ec_shortdesc: Valpolicella Ripasso wines are Valpolicellas that have been re-passed (i.e., undergone a second fermentation) over used Amarone skins. Ripassos are richer and more complex than Valpolicellas and stylistically fall between these and Veneto's big Amarones. This one is charming, with ripe red fruit, cherry, spice and oak.

title: Catena Lunlunta Old Vines Appellation Malbec 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: The 2021 Appellation Lunlunta Malbec was produced with grapes from vines planted in 1930 at 920 meters in altitude. It fermented with full malolactic and had an élevage of six to eight months in barrels, some 40% of them new. The cool year kept the alcohol to a moderate 13.5% with the depth and wisdom from old vines that somehow transmit a sense of harmony. This classical zone in Maipú produces traditional Malbecs with varietal typicity, floral with berries and herbs and a touch of sweet spices, fresh and balanced with some earthy rusticity and juicy fruit. Drink date: 2023-2028. Score - 92. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Nov. 30, 2022)

title: Orin Swift Abstract 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: A proprietary red blend of Petite Sirah, Grenache, Syrah, and Zinfandel aged eight months in 31% new oak. Orin Swift has opened a new, lovely tasting lounge in the town of St. Helena, CA and is worth a visit for those coming to the Napa Valley. Dave Phinney, the founder of Orin Swift, calls all the picks and continues working and honing these wines in the cellar. Rich black cherry, toffee, and caramel spices lead to a full-bodied wine with red berry fruit and chocolatey, robust, chewy tannins. The long fruit-driven finish offers ample brown spices and toasty cedarwood. Drinking window: 2024-2028. Score - 92. (Jonathan Cristaldi, decanter.com, Dec. 14, 2023)

title: Angove Family Crest Shiraz 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: From a range of sites of varied geology, this was fermented in open concrete vats with indigenous yeasts; élevage in French oak puncheons and hogsheads. From a cool year, there's notable elegance to this, though the fruits are both red and black - dark cherry and plum, blackberry, raspberry - accented with a tarry, charry note, master stock spices, mint, cacao nibs and cracked earth and iron-like mineral notes. It over-delivers at this tariff. Drink from: 2023. Drink by: 2031. Special Value. Score - 92. (winecompanion.com.au, Feb. 4, 2024)

title: Featherstone Red Tail Merlot 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: A ridiculously affordable price for a Merlot this good. The wine is aged in 100% fine French oak barrels (25% new) from Tonnellerie Sirgue Nuits Saint Georges for 10 months. There is an intriguing, perfumed note on the nose with dark cherries, black raspberries, cassis, integrated spices, and subtle earthy accents. It's rich with some tannic structure and weight on the palate followed by juicy red berries, anise, cassis, and elegant spice notes through a long, lifted finish. [You] can age this for 5+ years and you can feel pretty damn happy you paid only $20 a bottle. Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, June 5, 2023)

title: Creekside Laura's Red 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: This expresses a lovely nose that immediately reminds of a ripe red Bordeaux. The tannins are notably stringent but not green. The length is very good to excellent. The finish does not quite live up to the aromatic expectation. Best now to 2026. Tasted Dec 2022. Score - 90. (David Lawrason, winealign.com)

title: Nederburg Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: With a history dating back to 1791, Nederburg has long-established itself as a premium South African wine producer. This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, sourced from the Western Cape, displays cassis, leather and spice aromas. The palate is well-structured, with ripe, grippy tannins and spice and black currant flavours.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: With a history dating back to 1791, Nederburg has long-established itself as a premium South African wine producer. title: Bar Dog Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: This approachable California cabernet sauvignon is a wonderful companion to a variety of food. Deep ruby in colour with inviting notes of coffee, cedar, berry mix, spice and honey. title: Bordón Gran Reserva 2013
raw_ec_shortdesc: If you like classical Rioja, this gran reserva may make you smile. Fully mature, it isn't a wine to keep but to enjoy over the coming year or two for its nuanced flavors that touch on blue fruit, yellow nectarines and green shishito peppers. The texture is rich and lively, a friendly Rioja that gains gravity and length with a day of air.  Score - 92. (wineandspiritsmagazine.com, Feb. 2023)

title: The Audacity of Thomas G. Bright Merlot Cabernet VQA
raw_ec_shortdesc: In 1874, Thomas G. Bright dared to dream that a Niagara winery could flourish and grow. Arterra Wines honours their pioneer with this full-bodied merlot/ cabernet blend.  It shows upfront aromas and flavours of caramel, prune and dark chocolate with a long, dry finish. Enjoy with beef and bacon sliders or stuffed peppers.

title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini Brunello di Montalcino 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Reserved on the nose for now, Donatella's 2019 Brunello is a firm and tightly wound wine, with excellent structure and depth, a serious 'annata' to be sure from a great vintage. All the elements line up nicely; this should drink well from 2027-2038 or so. Tasted November 2023. Score - 94. (John Szabo, MS, winealign.com)

title: The Black Shiraz
raw_ec_shortdesc: A bold Aussie shiraz with striking package design, this red will grace many dinner tables. Sourced from South Eastern Australia, it shows upfront aromas of cassis, juniper, smoke and citrus that continue to intense cassis, smoke and blood orange flavours and a long, structured finish. Pair with steak and roasted vegetables.

title: Heartland Stickleback Red 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: From legendary winemaker Ben Glaetzer (the man behind the iconic Amon-Ra Shiraz), this is Heartland's entry-level red. It's a classic Aussie blend of Cabernet and Shiraz that gets a touch of additional brightness and lift from a splash of Dolcetto of Piedmont fame. It's floral, with ripe dark fruit, spice and savoury notes. A fun, easy-to-enjoy wine that's ideal for barbecue.

title: Clos Apalta 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: A generous array of ripe black and blue fruit with pink peppercorns, green olives, dried flowers, toffee and chocolate orange. It's full-bodied with firm, creamy and velvety tannins. Long and polished. Lovely salted caramel and olives at the end. Keeps going. Unfolds on the finish. 70% carmenere, 18% merlot, 8% cabernet sauvignon and 4% petit verdot. Drink or hold [for 15+ years]. Score - 99. (jamessuckling.com, Dec. 28, 2022)

title: Jacob's Creek Shiraz Cabernet Sauvignon
raw_ec_shortdesc: Legendary in South Eastern Australia, Jacob's Creek presents a modern expression of the classic Aussie blend of shiraz and cabernet sauvignon red wine. Expect aromas of dark cherry and plum with mocha spice. The palate offers blackberry, plum with pepper and subtle oak. Enjoy with steak, pizza or tomato-based pasta dishes.

title: Torbreck Old Vines Grenache/Mourvèdre/Shiraz 2022
raw_ec_shortdesc: Australia is home to some of the oldest ungrafted Grenache, Mataro (a.k.a. Mourvèdre) and Shiraz (a.k.a. Syrah) in the world, and Torbreck has plots that range up to 160 years. Made from fruit picked by hand, this wine is aged for 24 months in old French oak. Rich and plush, it delivers ripe red and dark fruit, spice, and delicate smoke and earth tones.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: Australia is home to some of the oldest ungrafted Grenache, Mataro (a.k.a. Mourvèdre) and Shiraz (a.k.a. Syrah) in the world, and Torbreck has plots that range up to 160 years. title: Puelles Reserva 2016
raw_ec_shortdesc: This bend of 94% tempranillo and 6% other Spanish varieties, all from old vines, was matured in oak for a total of 24 months. It delivers a very attractive and well-layered flavour profile dominated by dark fruit and some spiciness, all complemented by well-balanced acidity.  The texture is soft, and the tannins are well resolved. Drink now to the late 2020s. (Tasted February 2024.) Score - 93. (Rod Phillips)

title: Calamus Ball's Falls Red
raw_ec_shortdesc: Alluring aromas of rich, dark berry fruit, dark chocolate and cassis abound on the nose of this deftly balanced, gorgeously flavoured red. It dishes up mouthfuls of sweet-tinged fruit - dark cherry and ripe bramble berry interwoven with excellent tang and acidity and mixed spice. It's medium bodied with good mouthfeel and a lengthy finish oozing with flavour, tangy acidity and plenty of charm. Load up the trunk and pour with steak, burgers or beef fajitas. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value!  Score - 91. (Vic Harradine, winecurrent.com, Feb. 20, 2023)

title: The Prisoner Red Blend
raw_ec_shortdesc: This bold blend combines Zinfandel with Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Charbono to create a robust, ripe, smooth salute to the 'mixed-blacks' field blends of early Italian immigrants to California. Named for and featuring the 1807 etching by Francisco de Goya on the label, this is a wine that will deliver prune, dark chocolate and toast alongside rich dark fruit preserve tones. A powerhouse wine that calls for a grilled steak.

title: Carnivor Shiraz
raw_ec_shortdesc: Australia's Carnivor Wines has a direct message - their wines are meant to partner with grilled meats. The Shiraz is medium-bodied and rich, and delivers a basketful of floral, nutty, prune, honey and smoky flavours. A spicy-sweet note rounds out a long and satisfying finish. Pair with smoked ribs or pork chops.

title: Rymill Coonawarra Classic Release Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
raw_ec_shortdesc: Blackberry pie (crust and all), licorice, cassis, star anise, bramble, garden mint, cigar box and tobacco leaf. In the mouth the wine is ultra-concentrated, firm and structured. This pays homage to both the variety and the region. It offers truth from every angle, leaving no lingering doubt about where this could possibly have come from, and what grape it is. It has a long life ahead of it. Drink from: 2022. Drink by: 2036. Score - 94. (Erin Larkin, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 3, 2022)

title: Château La Caminade Malbec/Merlot 2021
raw_ec_shortdesc: An interesting, somewhat atypical blend for a French wine, with 70% Malbec, 25% Merlot, and 5% Tannat adding texture and well-integrated tannins to this firm red. title: Contucci Mulinvecchio Vino Nobile di Montepulciano 2018
raw_ec_shortdesc: A taut, structured single-vineyard wine that's quite accomplished. Elegant and focused, it's opulent without sacrificing freshness or poise. Look for complex notes of crushed strawberry, juicy sour cherry, earth, white pepper and toast. Drink now through early 2030s.
raw_lcbo_tastingnotes: A taut, structured single-vineyard wine that's quite accomplished. Elegant and focused, it's opulent without sacrificing freshness or poise. Look for complex notes of crushed strawberry, juicy sour cherry, earth, white pepper and toast. Drink now through early 2030s.
